text: The service was good, atmosphere fine. I had a chopped chicken salad. It had 5 tiny slices of chicken, a 1/2 cup of iceberg, an entire raw onion cut on top, a few tomatoes. It was a salad I could have purchased in a bag at the grocery store, only difference was it was $13. Not impressed.

Second visit. First time in was during happy hour. Ordered off the happy hour menu and was very pleased with the entire visit and I would have given 4 stars at that time. Today was a different story. Had to wait 10 minutes for a table, ok if busy, but restaraunt was basically empty, but was told we had to wait to see if people who made reservations would show up. Finally seated and were given water by a waitress who was over the top perky. I appreciate upbeat people, but dont talk to me like I am a child at the doctors office, you come off as fake and irritating. Two of the water glasses had black stuff at the bottom. Showed to waitress she commented that it was probably fruit flies. It looked like cracked black pepper or small bits of charcoal to me. Glasses were removed.
Food was ordered and arrived in a short amount of time. Appetizers were ok, but the dipping sauce for both the pretzles and chips were  bland..Ordered a firebrand chicken sandwich, was told the the bread was a flatbread, their version of pita bread. Turned out that it was served on a pretzle bread/roll, which tasted ok, just not what was advertised. I had their black angus burger. Dissapointing to say the least. The smallest 1/3 pound burger I have ever seen. Small plain bun, two pickle chips, two limp red onion rings, no lettuce or tomato, and a petite amount of ketchup that was not enough for the burger, let alone the fries. Asked for more ketchup and mustard, another petite portion arrived. I am a big boy, I can handle a ketchup bottle, I promise not to waste or make a mess. The flavor of the burger was the dealbreaker. It had a intense chemical taste, at first I thought a gas grill flavor, but the more I ate the more it tasted like charcoal lighter fluid.I did not finish. 
I have no problem paying top dollar for my food, but I expect to get what I pay for. (see Becketts Table) I will be back for half price happy hour food , but will likely not be ordering off the full price menu again

Quite possibly the worst service I have ever had. Dinner took 3 hours in total. Food was cold when it came out, and the server brought out the wrong order. Rather than taking it back, she asked if we "were good with eating the steak she brought" instead of our food. Awful, awful experience. Not worth the try.

Limited kids meals..Pricey. and not enough choices.
My egg dish was bland. Good service but waited for a while to get check. Like the outdoor patio.

I don't know why I continue to waste my time with this place - overpriced mediocre food and the most unfriendly staff in Arcadia.

I guess I just want it to be good because of the location, but I'm over it.

Last time I'm there we walk in and ask if we can watch the NBA Playoff game - the bar tender tells us he's rather watch the hockey so sorry.  Pretty intense.

The parking is problematic as the lot is very small.  Lunch menu is pretty expensive and bland.  The live entertainment is not what it used to be.  Check out the beer pizza special for dinner.  There are 700 restaurants in the area and this place needs to find a niche.

We went for lunch on a Friday. I really want to like this place because it is so close to my home. It has a decent atmosphere and I found the staff perfectly pleasant. I have no complaints with the personnel.

Unfortunately, my rating is as is because of the food. The food is the key to a good restaurant so it's going to drive my rating.

I had the "Black Angus Burger" which ultimately amounted to two beef patties with cheese on a bun. It was sort of like meatloaf between buns. I admit I left the onions off but I guess I didn't read the menu carefully enough - that's all it was. No lettuce, no tomatoes, nothing else except some pickles attached to the top with a toothpick. It was just a hunk of meat with cheese. I have to say it was a bit gross.

My companion had the "Chicken Salad Wrap" which also turned out to be surprisingly simple. Basically some chicken salad scooped into a soft bread rolled into a wrap. Nothing special.

Both entrees came with fries that neither of us found particularly good.

We were both disappointed but we are going to give it another try. Maybe we just ordered two of their less than stellar menu items. However, a burger is pretty basic.

So... I can't say don't go but at this point, the food just doesn't hold up. Again, no problems with the atmosphere or staff.

I've now been to Kitchen 56 on two occasions and both times I was dissatisfied. I feel like this place could be so much more but just isn't. I agree with most reviews on here that the food wasn't bad but just nothing special at all, especially for the price. Unless you go during happy hour, which I do hear is good, things are very overpriced.  

The staff is friendly enough but the service was terrible. On one occasion our entire table had nearly finished our entrees before one member of our group had received his food. Both times I have been the service from the wait staff and kitchen has been extremely slow, even when there is no one in the restaurant.  

Unless you are going for happy hour, or just enjoy very mediocre restaurants, Skip it.

Blah!!!!  Strange menu!  I have tried this place 4 times now.  Each time I am disappionted so, today was the last try.  Food has no flavor.  They are doing nothing interesting here and the service is lame.

Ate here tonight. For a four top, it was about $75, not too bad!  Ordered 3 burgers and a rib platter.   Service was terrible as the server didn't bother to write down the orders. One person ordered a full slab of ribs with extra sauce on the side, received only half a slab and no extra sauce. One person ordered a burger with fries, received a salad. Third person ordered a green chili burger with fries and fries were half done. I ordered a double cheese burger with fries. I also asked for mayo, ketchup and mustard on the side. Server said beef patties were 5 oz each. So I thought I should get a pretty large sandwich. WRONG.  Restaurant must use 60/40 or 70/30 ground beef, as I kid you not, I could place both of those patties side by side to fill up the bun. Ordered medium and received medium, however the burger was so burnt on the outside, it was inedible. Should get lettuce, tomato and pickle? Nope just onion and sweet pickles. Sorry but if your menu says pickle on a burger, you should assume dill, unless otherwise specified. So I received a charred inedible burger, with onion and sweet pickles. No sauce. Had to ask for the mayo and mustard. Fries were half cooked and al dente. Fries should never be al dente!  I picked everything apart and probably ate less than one sixth of my food. It was nice of the server to ask if I wanted a to-go box for the chopped up mess on my plate!  This was the third time I have eaten here. First time was cocktails and apps on the patio. That was great. Second time was only for desert, as my friend received a free desert coupon for his birthday. When we arrived, even though the coupon doesn't specify, it turns out you need to order an entree to get your free desert. Third time was a total disaster. I have worked food service for 30 years and have never written such a lengthy review. Please tell me Kitchen 56, why should I return?

I don't understand all these negative reviews.  First of all I like having a restaurant in this neighborhood within walking distance. Sure beats having an abandoned purple car garage. Normally I don't write a review for restaurants.  If I am happy with the food I go back, if not I don't return. I am not the type to want to hurt people's business because of my one experience. I feel like it shows a certain self importance to think that your one experience at a restaurant is typical of all experience. 

Getting to the review. Each time I have eaten here my party and I have been very happy with the food and service. Today I went for lunch, which is something new they are offering.  I am happy they are offering lunch.  Prices are right in the ballpark for what you would expect at lunch at $8-$12 range.  The lunch plates come with fries or salad which to me wasn't obvious based on the online menu.  I had a turkey, egg, and cheese with fries.  I love egg sandwiches so I was happy to see it on the menu and it didn't disappoint. I had the fries which were good.  My partner had the veggie burger which they were happy with.  They really enjoyed the actual veggie patty which they could tell was homemade.   

The restaurant was crowded and doing a good business which I was happy to see.  I was also happy to see they handled the lunch rush well with the service being great.  All in all an excellent experience and will definitely return.

This place is a true disaster. Have eaten here twice. Once with a large party. They knew we where coming 3 days ahead of our arrival.  Poor planning on there part. Our group came for Brunch.  Understaffed.  We had 15 people. Remember we told them 3 days before our arrival how large our party was. One waitress for that large party. Food came out very sporadically. Even 15 to 20 minutes apart. Then overcooked and not what people had order.  Then my husband and I went back about 3 weeks later. We were sat down. Then 5 minutes went by before a person showed up at our table. Took our drink order. Then came back to take our order. Well then the real waiting  began. 15 minutes no drinks 35 minutes no food. Excuse given was the bartenders don't  know how to open a bottle of liquor that's why our drinks are late. Then our food was late due to new kitchen staff the same excuse that was  given when we went for brunch. Never again. Save yourself the trouble go to a Dennys.

I live in the area and have been wanting to try this place for a while.  I took my friend here for a celebratory dinner last week.  Overall, we like this place.  Service was very good.  The bottle of wine we ordered was out of stock, so our server suggested another bottle but offered it at the same price as the bottle we wanted.  Nice gesture.  

The corn cakes with pulled pork appetizer was probably the highlight of the meal.  Very good.  The Arcadia Salad was also good.  Being from New Mexico and loving green chile, the green chile Mac n Cheese was a little dissapointing.  The ribs were ok.  Certainly not fall off the bone.

Love the ambiance and openess...with the exception of the music.  More about that below.  Interesting artwork with the chalk board feature, although it is so cluttered to the point that we couldn't take it all in.  Sometimes less is more.  

As I aluded to earlier...I'm a firm believer that music is the single-most make or break factor to a great ambiance.  The music simply does not fit.  Paula Abdul did not add to my enjoyment of dinner in any way.  Maybe we were just at a cheesy point of the mix, but I think some more edgy/progressive/hip music could do a lot in further creating an enjoyable ambiance.

Overall, I'm a fan.  Good Job.

The place has potential due to location and atmosphere. Service was good. However the food wasn't worth the price.
My girlfriend had the skillet pot pie and the crust was amazing and the presentation was fine. But the filling pie tasted like canned stew. It tasted as if it was obviously NOT made from scratch.
I had the Angus green chili burger. It tasted fine because the quality of the beef was well, but it was a very small patty. And the fries that came with it also tasted good but was a small portion. A restaurant should know that the cost of fries is so low compared to the other products and should stack the plate full of fries to compliment the meal.
Again i feel that the place has potential.
I would only comeback for strictly cocktails and would not eat off the menu unless i absolutly knew changes were made.
Good service though.

I went there for lunch with my family. We were not very impressed with the menu, maybe we are just spoiled from normally having lots of options but it was basically salad, burgers, sandwiches, or Mac n cheese. I had the pulled pork but the flavor was too smoky for me. There isn't necessarily anything wrong with this place, but we won't be back.

went there many times and the place is quite good, the food portions a generous and a little off beat.  The service is always excellent.
Highlights calamari salad and house made potato chips n dip
should start every meal.
Beet salad was very good n flavor full.
Pizzas is always a crowd pleaser.
A wonderful addition to the neighborhood.

Best burger and service I have had in a long time.

1.The burger and fries that I had at this restaurant was the best I have had in a long time. Cooked properly and seasoned perfectly. Fries were fresh cut potato and well disappeared off my plate.

2. The server was kind good at giving recommendations and made the experience that much better. my drink never got empty and attention was paid to what we needed for the table. I have never been more pleased with a wait staff in a long time.

The only gripe I have is parking and the ability to get in can be a little annoying but a good hole in the wall none the less.
Cool place. Great food and Service. Really enjoyed the Wings and BBQ Sandwich.  The Calamari Appetizer was fantastic.

I've been here twice for girl's nights out and I love it. The patio is absolutely wonderful.  It's great for a group gathering. There is room to mingle and the drink/wine menu is huge. I love their "Grown Up" Lemonade. The food is also great. I would suggest a cheese plate to start. The honey and the cheeses are all great. I would definitely suggest the Arcadia salad, it's super tasty. I also really enjoyed the sear Ahi tuna. I do want to head there for one of their special event brunches. I've been impressed with the food so far and brunch is by far my favorite meal.
I had the green chili burger with the brussel sprout hash.  Excellent!  The design aesthetic in the place is great.  I love the large black and white photo on the west wall.

Nice layout and modern touch inside and out. I was there for lunch and had the fish and chip special. The fish was tasteless.  All tasted was batter, not sure what kind of fish it was but will not get it again. They have 5 dollar lunch special every day and happy hour menu. The drinks did look very tasty. Id like to try the BBQ rib tacos next time. The entree did get kind of pricey, like 20 plus. I pray that they are not all show like the fish. The presentation looked very nice and classy.

****update

I went for happy hour.

Drinks were excellent , lots of variety and only 5$ for their specialty drinks.

My friend ordered the Rib Tacos and was not impressed. She said there was barely any meat on them and what was there was fatty.

A great neighborhood spot. They did a very nice job designing the space, emphasizing a fun hipster vibe. Also has a small outdoor patio where dogs are welcome. Good happy hour specials. I'm not much of a drinker, so I can't speak to the quality of their martinis, but you can see the effort that went into their drink menu. 

I did have a bit of a problem with my food order. A hamburger, ordered medium as was encouraged by the waitress, was actually raw in the middle. It received some extra grill time and was returned to the table with the comment, "next time I'll remind you to order medium well." It was raw in the center! No great apology was needed, but it was the kitchen's error, not the diner's. The rest of our food was quite good.

Still four stars you say, even after being served a raw burger? Yes, a reflection of how much I liked the ambiance of Kitchen 56.

Love this place.  Here right now on a Saturday night.  Enjoying a nice evening with friends hanging at the bar.  Had wings, onion strings and some awesome pork pancakes(seriously.  Not sure what they are called but they're great).  Bar area is open with a nice ooutdoor patio behind it.  Going to play ping pong now with a cold beer.  Ciao!
First time - good food and beer - neat neighborhood restaurant, bar and location - will come back when up this way

My husband and I love this little place.  We often go during happy hour for a beer and appetizer.  The happy hour menu is great; bruschetta, baked pretzel, mini tacos plus more..  Draft beers are 1.00 off, wine is 2.00 off.  Both beer and wine selections are excellent.  The staff is friendly and service us tops.  We are thrilled to have discovered this little hide away.
Place was just ok.  I am a green /red chili snob and green chili was not very good.  People and service was good.

I was in the area and not familiar with it, and of course, looked up somewhere to eat on Yelp.
Cool local pub with good food, friendly bartenders, locals were friendly too, and a very decent one man guitar playing soloist which added to a nice dinner with B-Ball on the tubes.
I had the pulled pork sandwich with onion strings...very good.  Slightly spendy but worth it.  I'd come back!

Service and food are a bit hit-and-miss. Its mushroom 'tart' is really flatbread featuring mushrooms - competent but like some of their other menu items ($10-plus for a giant baked potato with pulled pork and the usual accoutrements) are overpriced. The green chili Mac and cheese may be a signature dish of 56 kitchen but it's a one-trick pony that can overwhelm so unless you're really into it, best select or split as a side. 

On another night we were here, waited 10-12 minutes before we were served water and we had to ask to order another 10 minutes later - despite sitting at the bar, where there were two servers. The prosciutto and figs pizza came out half lukewarm, with 3 of the slices featuring no prosciutto. Granted, there was a large (trivia) party in dining room but it's still lackluster execution.

The staff's friendliness doesn't overcome these shortcomings, alas.

The food & drink here is amazing! Such a great ambiance!  If the weather is nice,  ask for a seat in the patio,  where the fountain makes it sound like you're dining next to a waterfall. :) also, if you bike in, you get a discount!

Salad with an avocado that was half unripe and half turning brown, a handful of kale, and a $10+price.  Leaden half raw french fries.  Shoe leather, disdainfully under-seasoned steak.  A near $6 side of not quite a handful of shredded brussel sprouts adorned with something akin to Dollar Store bottled Italian dressing. Cute bungalow/diner decor, and a 4 star, kind, caring waitress who seemed as dismayed as her customers with the food, raised my score to a 2 Star.  Owners/chefs please take a ride down to the Vig or the Henry and take in a little TLC and bring it home.

Kitchen 56 is a nice neighborhood restaurant and they continue to improve.  We went once when it was Vatra and would not have returned had it stayed the same.  The free parking across 56th Street is a nice addition.   As is the new menu.  

We've gone for dinner with the kids in the late Spring, 2011- I had the burger and it was big and delicious.  My daughters giggled with delight when they saw their kid's spaghetti plate- three separate small bowls on a long, narrow platter.  One bowl had noodles, one had the 'sauce on the side' and the other a fruit salad.  Great price at $6.  My husband opted for the Ahi dinner- that was the bummer choice of the evening.  The ahi tuna steak lacked the flavor and texture I expect at $21 a plate.  It was cooked rare, so that wasn't the issue- just cut and quality of the fish.  The wine selection is ok, but the waiter didn't really know the nuances  between the wine by the glass, yet.  

The patio is lovely and nice to see neighbors we know.  Since it is a neighborhood restaurant, it would be nice to be welcomed by the owners or management from time to time.  UPDATE:  I returned for lunch with a girlfriend in May, 2011.  The owner spent quite a bit of time chatting with us and explaining menu choices, their remodel, etc.  She was trained by their general manager and is the day manager.  Nice touch!
I love this place! I bring clients here a lot and they always rave about the food. Best Mac & cheese ever.
Food not consistent, also, never saw the "bike" discount reflected in our bill...

You might really like the squishy, comfortably wide, white barstools at Kitchen 56. I do. The bar straddles the patio and the restaurant, which is good for people watching, too. Although, you might be distracted by some kitchen traffic.

I never find myself saying "let's go for dinner," but definitely, "let's meet there." Other restaurants - the Grind is nearby - have menus to brag about. But Kitchen 56 has an open feel, with appreciable curiosities on the walls, and the service has been uniformly engaging.

Good consistent food, the pizzas are always phenomenal. Love both the corncakes pulled pork appetizer and the edamame. 

Great place to meet friends for a drink on the patio, or have a nice date with my husband!
Delicious and different, optimal service but casual, small but spacious, sophisticated and also family friendly! Green Chili Mac & Cheese is awesome!

Went to Kitchen 56 last night and had the WORST service I have ever had at any restaurant!! The waiter was so incredibly RUDE!!!!! The food was ok, but the time was ruined by the service! Even talked to the manager on duty and she seemed clueless. Don't waste your time going to this place!!!!!

My favorite place in the hood! I love the service....always friendly...like they are glad we are there! Edamame rocks and so do happy hour chicken tacos if you like a little kick!!! Meanwhile.....I can bring my dog to the patio when it isn't hot!!!!  It's a big YES at K56!

Love this place! I grew up in Scottsdale and recently moved to Dallas. Upon coming back I noticed that the neighborhood "car joint" was transitioned to a local restaurant and bar. This place us by far one of the best new developments in Scottsdale! Order the green tea lemonade and ask for Stefan!!!

Very underwhelming and not worth the money. Only positive was the cool drinks. However, service was awful. It took 25 minutes to get our first drink after we ordered. A couple if us had the corn cakes-nothing special. Others got the wings, again nothing special. I had the green chili Mac and cheese-again, nothing special. Everything lacked real flavor and that mixed with the poor service made it a bad experience. Won't be back and do not recommend.

We have been going to Kitchen 56 for years, because we loved the Calamari. It was served on the most delicious Asian slaw with peanut sauce.  We actually got hungry for it and went what seemed like once a month.  We were out of town for the summer and couldn't wait to go back.  We were so disappointed to find it is no longer on the menu.  The whole menu seems to have changed and we found it very plain and uninteresting.  Probably won't be going back any time soon.

Good happy hour drinks, great service, but mediocre food. We had the fish and chips, they were very greasy and kind of bland. I also had the vegetable soup to start with and was so oily, that I could not eat it.

We really wanted to like this place... especially since we live less than .5 mile away... it was that same cold vibe when we were there. So sad. I don't get it, it looks like it would have so much potential. Too bad they went so modern with the design of it all. A patio dining experience to me is twinkle lights, hanging plants, cozy chairs, laughter, a friendly bar tender who likes their job, tells jokes, has a warm vibe... but no... none of this. Also, why do people decide to open places like this without great simple food? They should make friends with the owner of Wally's, and take a few notes. Good food+ laid back vibe= talk of the neighborhood. Not a difficult business model. 

I'd like this place to add some fun tables out front, where you can sip on wine and enjoy the vibe of the hood, some nice outdoor music, hanging planters, a courtyard with grass instead of the 5 parking spots they have there...a doggie dish outside of it all with a menu that has the best wings in town, the best pasta dishes, a nice breakfast menue, and a neat coffee bar!

I'm still as obsessed as I was the first time I came here. 

They have a redesigned menu with slightly higher prices but the PBR is still cheap and I've yet to find better waiters elsewhere. Our old waiter even came up and said hi. Huge thumbs up to Kitchen 56!

I have been visiting this restaurant since they opened and haven't written a review because every time we come it's a different experience. On our visit today for lunch the one major change I noticed is the prices went up. More than what I think is fair. 

We visited during the lunch hour and almost every thing was $12-$16. Most salads don't have a protein and the salad that I ordered had so little chicken it should be considered bacon bits. We also had Mac and Cheese $12 again for nothing memorable. Noodles and Cheese. Service was slow... I usually hope to have my food within 15-20 minutes for lunch service but it seemed to push the later end of the time frame. 

We love the patio and the view of Camelback is great. 

We may come back for a drink but we won't be eating here again anytime soon.

Oh and they had a fly problem. We had 2-3 circling our heads for the hour we were there.
I love this place for the carefully selected menu and the amazing cocktails. It deserves a lot more business.

We won't be back.  Pricey turkey cranberry sandwich sounded great---  BUT deli turkey, not roast turkey... really?  Cute space though...  wonder why no hand towels in the ladies room?  Just not the best....

Where to start?

For the last 25 hours I have been riding my toilet like it was a shit covered race horse charging me through the gates of gastrointestinal Hell. 

Its now gotten so bad that the pyrotechnics in my ass have inspired me to changing show tunes into songs about what feels like giving rectal birth to a fire coated wet cappuccino machine, complete with foam and the associated noises that go with it.

One of the better ones I've come up with due to something going very, very wrong at Kitchen 56's kitchen was:

"I feel shitty.
Oh so shitty. 
So shitty, and sharty and brown!!!
And I pitty any girl who isn't shitting her brains out today!"

I think the writers of West Side Story would be proud of the spin-off that's spinning down the bowl of my toilet right now.

The only thing I ate yesterday was a burger, fries, slaw and an iced tea at Kitchen 56. 

My girlfriend had some of the same fries, the same slaw, and the same bun.

Since yesterday around 9pm to now, we've both been playing "dueling bathrooms." Thank god we have two bathrooms, or someone would have had to use the bath tub.

So which of those four things was it? Or did someone just not  wash their hands in the kitchen after using the head? Either way, it wrecked my President's day.

And then there was the service. It was shitty too. Delivering the wrong meals to us, messing up the way the food was cooked and prepared, and forgetting about us for the first 20 minutes we were there.

All and all, even though its close to where we live, I won't be going back. One night of "shitting myself skinny" is enough. On the upside, this is the first burger that helped me to dropping 8 pounds over night. I think it was all out of my butt and from the sweats associated with the raw panic of going back into the toilet. When you're making deals with god, and are offering to give up your hedonistic ways, just because of one burger, its time to never, ever go back to wherever served it to you.

Comfortable atmosphere with decent food. We sat in the bar section and was served by the bartender. He was super friendly, made excellent drinks (bloody beer, old fashion) and answered our questions about the menu with ease and sincerity. Had a nice enjoyable Sunday dinner.

Let me start off by saying that I have no clue why this restaurant is 3.5 stars. It deserves a much higher rating. I had the pulled pork sandwich and the bacon cheddar mac and cheese with a Caesar salad. Everything was very fresh and the garlic fries had great flavor. I had the cookie for dessert. The server was very friendly and accommodating to our entree requests. I split everything with my wife. We will return!

We haven't been here for over a year but we used to come here almost every week. We were saddened to see how the menu changed. No longer have the Arcadia pizza or fish tacos; and changes made to the brussel sprout hash and calamari. 
The beet salad I ordered for over $13 was basically a bed of greens with a few beet slices, a few bites of goat cheese and a few bites of prosciutto (basically not enough of any of them to think they are actually part of the salad).
Our service was good. Getting drinks was slow but a large group of people came in right before us. 
Sadly, we won't be back which upsets us because we used to love this place.

I've only been here 6 months and I've seen this location be 3 different restaurants. I met a friend here for happy hour to check out this place and see if this one is gonna make it. 

The Cons: the space isn't used well. They need to make the bar area a lot bigger and use their space more wisely. There is a lot of floor and not enough chairs. They should also expand their local beer menu. I was sad the Four Peaks Peach had left.

The Pros: good happy hour menu, good food, unique specialty drink menu and an attentive staff.

The fish tacos were tasty and the black cherry lemonade was ok. Tacos, I love em. I think this place can make it. It had a crowd all night. Cheers!
Great food great service and friendly staff. The other really great thing is the family friendly environment.  We had an age range of 2 - 60 and everyone felt welcome.

Fun decor on the inside, and a nice outdoor seating area as well (bonus - they have a ping pong table out there!). Word of warning: there was a bit of a funky smell while sitting outside, and we think it was the canal. If it's really hot out, maybe think twice about sitting outside because I'm sure the heat will intensify the smell. Or maybe it was just something in the air Saturday night. 

Anyway, on to the food! 

I knew I wanted to get dessert so I went lighter for my meal. I went with their Santa Fe Grilled Chicken Breast which came with a petite salad. Salad was mixed greens with tomatoes and red onions and a vinaigrette dressing. Basic, but tasty. There was two HUGE pieces of chicken that came with the meal, so I was impressed with the portion size. I ate one piece and was able to box up the other for another meal. 

For dessert I got their peanut butter and chocolate mousse. Yummy. Next time I want to try their sticky toffee pudding thing. 

My boyfriend got their tempura tofu with veggies and soba noodles. I took a bite and it was pretty good, and he liked it as well. He did say it was better after adding some Sriracha. 

Service was good though, and all around it was a good dining experience. Would definitely go back!

I've been to Kitchen 56 for a couple of happy hours before and the experiences were probably about 3.5 star-worthy.  The outdoor patio is cute, the wine selection is decent, and the happy hour is better than the Vig's if you prefer wine over beer.  This solidly-decent streak was broken last night when seven of us showed up and were told there was no room for us on the patio.  Fine, we took a table in the dining room.  A manager stopped by to apologize for not being able to accomodate our desire to sit outdoors.  We forgave her.

Our waiter was surly, telling us he was the one who was "forced" to help us.  I get that it was a wry joke (maybe!) but there was zero humor behind it, and he seemed more genuine than not.  He then informed us that we did not "qualify" for happy hour because we were not seated at the bar or on the patio.  He was so unapologetic that I thought he was joking.  We asked if we could have the special anyway as we were there specifically FOR happy hour and had intended to sit outside if the few tables had not already been taken.  He disappeared to ask and returned with a solid N-O.  We decided that this would not stand, and walked out as multiple members of the waitstaff and the manager watched, expressionless.  Guess they had already made too much money that day and didn't have any more room for ours.

The dining room was empty, by the way.  WTF mate?  Seven of us could easily have racked that tab up to $200 in drinks alone, if only they had let us partake of their flimsy happy hour deals (which do not include food specials) for the one hour that was remaining of the special.  Real nice, Kitchen 56.  REAL NICE.

They really deserve one star for that as my previous experiences weren't exactly shining examples of service, but, unlike the staff at Kitchen 56, I am feeling a little generous today.

I think this place is newer, b/c they didn't quite seem to have the A+ service thing down quite yet.  Looks like they'll get there at some point, as they comped a portion of a friend's meal for bringing it out late.  

I'm an edamame nut - there's was done with a great little kick, or punch - heat, that is, but over olive oiled.  

Had the Turk burger, with small salad side.  Looked cool with the red and yellow bell peppers on it - the turkey burger that is...cooked fine, and tasted dyn-o-mite.  

So style and taste bonus points.  Salad was fresh with a nails mustard ving dressing?  Ok.

It's got a cool little atmosphere for a Happy Hour; great little wine bar off to the side. 
 
Recommend.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while now since it is within  a few miles of where we live.  I finally was able to stop by and ordered the spaghetti and meatballs to go.
While waiting for the order, I sat at a very comfortable barstool and was able to check out the dining room and look at the dinner menu.  I found the place to be somewhat cold, it definitely needs some ambiance. I enjoy minimalist interiors as much as the next person, but a couple of fresh flowers on the tables would go a long way here.
When I returned home and opened my order, at first I thought they had made a mistake - the spaghetti looked like it was a children's order.  In addition, instead of the red marinara sauce I expected, the sauce was an orange color, like Chef Boyardee in a can. The pasta was the thick type of spaghetti, not the thinner, spaghettini type traditionally used in Italy,  and some sort of cheese was melted over it, also a no-no in traditional Italian kitchens. It tasted terrible - the pasta wasn't cooked al dente, it was overcooked and rubbery, the sauce had no taste and the tasteless cheese just made rubbery mess out of the whole dish. The meatballs were just okay, and again, they had the mystery cheese melted over them, which took away from their taste.
I am willing to give them another chance and would love to try some of the other pasta dishes, such as the papardelle with pork sauce,  but I would NOT recommend the spaghetti and meatballs to anyone.

My wife and I both grew up in the Arcadia area but now live out in North Scottsdale. We had driven by Kitchen 56 a few weeks back and decided to try it out. We arrived on Thursday the 30th of May during happy hour. The appetizers were really great and such a low price. We had fish tacos, short rib tacos and fish and chips. Really really good, the service was very good and the server was very friendly and knowledgeable. Just loved the place!

Kitchen 56 is absolutely fantastic. I have been there many times, and tonight was no exception. The owner was in and very personable, the bar staff was super pleasant and very attentive, and the food as always amazing. The advice to get are the chicken wings. They're fried and then grilled!!! Always need some extra time on the grill, so let your server know! Awesome place, great location, and great happy hour (3-6pm daily). Love this

Was impressed with this restaurant to start with, but I think it is getting full of its self a bit -- each time we have gone back has been a little worse.  The patio is nice, but the time we sat there for lunch -- it was honestly swarming with flies. After about 20 minutes the waitress did bring out some candles, but it really killed it for me. We've had flies inside too-- makes me wonder whats going on in the kitchen.
THe food is good -- but I don't really think it is worth the price. Even with the view and location thrown in. 
The kicker for me, was last time we went, our family of four spent about 70 + but my child asked for half and half of  the children's sides (a little fruit and a few fries). Most places will do this-- fries are cheap and cantalope is like a dollar a bucket. But no-- they can't do that at 56 - you have to order extra. Then I see a statement on the menu "If you liked your food, send a 6-pack of PBJs to the chefs for $10"
So now I get to overpay for food, and tip for average service, and I'm encouraged to buy the chefs their after/during shift drinks???  
It feels like the owners are there to pat themselves on the back - not create a great dining experience for the customers...

Cute place, unfortunately the worst food! Service was terrible even with two servers and a hostess and only two other small tables in the whole place besides us. Had to wait extremely long for empty drinks to be acknowledged and filled. Sat several times with empty drinks. On top of waiting forever for our food (which we could see sitting under heat lamp for ten plus minute) the food came out terrible. Most of it was cold, the burger smelled rotten, their fries were chewy (not crunchy) and everything lacked flavor. We waisted the majority of our terrible food and payed $50.00 for food that was not edible. (When we could finally get the server to acknowledge we had been waiting forever for our tab) never again!!!!
Had a good time tonight. Our selection was cilantro wings and fries, virgin raspberry mojito,ginger beer with vodka cocktail and brownie ala mode. Would return.

Very limited menu for lunch but what they do prepare is delish. I had the smoke turkey and fried egg sandwich and my companion had the pulled pork. We both thought they were tasty. Very stylish inside and I would like to try it for dinner.

We really like this place.  Nice servers, cozy, friendly, nice patio, affordable prices, great neighborhood place.  Unfortunately, the food is not properly executed.  The kitchen staff needs to step it up, and be sure they are cooking the food to the correct temperatures as they are ordered.  Burgers overcooked, fried calamari like rubber bands, pizza crust doughy.  Sorry... we really do like the place but the food is a disappointment.

Atmosphere, alcohol, and service.  If that's all your looking for, then you've found a nice spot.  However, if you intend on eating I'd suggest you continue driving down the street to one of the many Scottsdale restaurants that will deliver a much better meal.  

We were part of a large party with a pre-ordered dinner, so perhaps this played into the quality....really hard to say.  Our grilled romaine salad tasted very reminiscent of those days when my father would douse the bbq with lighter fluid and then attempt to tell us later the flavor that was strangely burning our tongues was "outdoor grilling at it's best".  Sorry, but it didn't work for Dad and it didn't work last night either.  I thought that perhaps the salad was a fluke, but unfortunately the disappointment continued through the bland spaghetti-o like pasta and the easy bake oven version of dessert.  

If any of the food had displayed the slightest bit of potential, I would have been happy to give them another shot.  But life is short and there's too many other restaurants putting forth a much better effort.

Very disappointed and annoyed.  They're closed for remodeling.  I get that, but one would expect their voice mail to state that and not say, they're busy leave a message or reservation....  had plans with friends...went there...surprise-surprise....  too many other choices...bad management and planning to not plan and not state on your voice mail and telephone that you're closed for remodeling.  Not what I'd expect from Kitchen 56 restaurant.
This place is great.  There is a relaxed feel in the restaurant with cozy booths and a good drink menu.  A nice variety of food too. Good service, must go back soon.

Hit. And. Miss.  The restaurant looks pretty cool at first glance but upon entering, it felt very cold and uninviting.  Nothing on the menu jumped out at me but I thought I would give it a shot anyways.  Our server was really friendly and helpful and made some nice suggestions for dinner.  We tried the Garlic and Cilantro wings for an appetizer and my boyfriend ordered the handmade Pappardelle pasta and I the Arugula and Fennel salad with grilled chicken.

The wings came out quickly but when the food runner brought them out he placed them on the table and immediately turned around without asking if we needed anything else.  Um...plates would have been nice.  I would think if your only job is running food to tables, you would be aware that side plates are necessary when you bring wings to a table.  We waited several minutes until the server returned from the back with plates.  

The wings tasted great, they were crispy with great flavor...until I bit all the way into them and noticed that they were way undercooked and still very pink.  Again, it took quite some time to even get the attention of anyone to alert them of the problem.  However, once we mentioned it, they quickly fired up a new order and brought them out, apologizing for the inconvenience.  I thought they handled the situation well (as the manager apologized and they comped two glasses of wine) so we brushed it off and enjoyed the new order of wings although they had overcompensated by practically burning the new order.

As for our entrees, we loved the Pappardelle pasta, it had great flavor and the slow roasted pork was amazing.  My salad, however, was probably the most boring, bland salad I have ever had.  It almost wasn't even worth eating.  I've had fennel in salads before and it normally adds a nice burst of flavor but the fennel was sliced so thinly that it added zero flavor and the sherry vinaigrette was equally as underwhelming.  

Overall, a very hit and miss experience.  I think this place has potential but needs some work as far as their back of the house operations.  The food was not executed well and the food runner clearly needed some training as each time he ran food to our table, he forgot to ask one very basic yet important question, "Can I bring you anything else?" 

Though we were not impressed, I still gave them 3 stars for the server and how they handled the wing situation.  I'm sure we will eventually give this place another shot once they have worked out some of the kinks.

Stumbled upon this place today on a drive by. Looked so cool, was drawn in. Really a great spot and the food that we ordered was perfect. The service was super friendly, attentive and helpful (we are out of towners)...the owner and her daughter were fawning over our pooch which always scores major points for us.

Let me just start by saying how utterly sad I am. We just left, about 10 minutes ago to go to chipotle, after getting our food... We have been die hard kitchen 56 patrons forever. Literally forever. We would go there every single weekend for the chilaquiles. Every weekend! We were so sad when they closed down for renovations. Let me tell you, these original chilaquiles were the absolute best food I've ever had in my entire life. Melt in your mouth. The green sauce, out of this world, and the potatoes, always seasoned to perfection. Well we get there and we are so excited, we get our "go to chilaquiles". I asked are they the same? The waiter's response: yes! Awesome! Well our meal finally comes to the table. The first thing we see, the three tortillas are all fully burned. Like black. We had to remove all of the edges. The cheese, different, laid on top, but it's not melted.... it's literally like they went in the fridge grabbed a piece of cheese and just threw it in top. Our eggs were both over hard ( I asked for over medium and my boyfriend asked for over easy). The green sauce is gone. It was just meat, and some pico sauce mixed together. Lastly, the potatoes which I was actually looking forward to, had absolutely no spices at all. Just grabbed out of the freezer and put in a pan. I'm just so sad. They didn't keep it the same. We broke our no carbs diet to come here, and it was not worth it . Please dear god bring back your original dish. No joke, it was the best food I've ever had. Why fix something that's not broken? Please! Please! Please! Bring it back!

The burrata is not burrata, and the zeppoles are not zeppoles.  In addition to the inacurracy of the menu descriptions, both items were poorly executed.  The mozzarella masquerading as burrata was dry and tasteless and the stale, hard fried dough sticks were, um, stale and hard.  

Of the other four items we ordered none were exceptional.  The calamari was quite good, the mussels were overcooked and rubbery, and the pepperoni pizza was acceptable as was the arugula salad.

Service was also lacking, with three different waitstaff involved in getting us our food late.  Overall disappointing.

I had been here for lunch a couple times, it was always great. This most recent was first time at dinner, i was so disappointed. The bartender was our wait person, he said the chicken was so tender uou could cut with a fork. I say only if there is a saber on the end of your fork. I shared my dissappointment woth him. He made no effort to correct. I under stand sometimes things get messed up. But i wish he had taken the initiative to correct. Bummer experience.

My girlfriend and I went on a double-date here with some friends last week.  My first impression was that the place was cute and I liked what they did with the space.  We were greeted by a friendly hostess and the overall feel was great.

The food is a different story:(  We started with the onion straws app which was decent.  I ordered the mac and cheese that came with a petit salad, my girlfriend ordered a tofu dish, and our friends ordered a steak special and a sandwich.  The steak which was ordered well (I know, I cringed, too) came out rare, the vinaigrette on my salad tasted rotten, the mac and cheese was middle of the road...I've had better and worse.  My girlfriend enjoyed her tofu and our friend said her sandwich was pretty good.  My green tea adult lemonade was fantastic!  The best part of my meal for sure!  When we ordered dessert I chose the creme brulee.  I sunk my spoon in and it just dripped off...ew!!! Creme brulee is supposed to be a custard-like consistency...it was definitely not set.  I was super bummed.  I would go back, because I totally believe in second chances...but with so many good restaurants out there...they better step it up!!

Great experience. Our waiter was super friendly. I had the burger and my girlfriend had the pulled pork sandwich (couldn't resist we could smell it when we came in) and they were both spectacular. The vibe was awesome we were dancing in our seats to the music the whole time. Awesome atmosphere as well. All around recommend Kitchen 56!

My favorite canal restaurant. The menu is very inventive although they have no problem charging for their food and cocktails. All their specialty drinks are very tasty (the Black Cherry Lemonade is awesome) but expensive. The views are great the place feels very comfortable inside, a great bar and good tables. I really watch what I eat and Kitchen 56 has some great menu options for low carb low fat items. They even have some vegetarian choices which is always nice to see. 
While the prices are high I believe I get good value for my money. I am not going to go here to drink all day but stopping in during a bike ride on the canal is great (they do give a 10% discount for bike riders).

Taco Tuesday!  Great Tacos, our server/bartender "Steve" took great care of us.

I liked the chicken over the short ribs.  And I like short ribs, but the aoli on the chicken was delicious.

The host was very prompt and pleasant. We asked to sit at a high top in the bar and she quickly got us waters. Our server stopped by and explained the wood fire grill. I ordered the steak firebread - she asked how I wanted it cooked - I said Med-rare. It came out medium but was still delicious. I love that they make their bread in house! My friend ordered the green chili mac with chicken, it was amazing. It always bothers me when servers don't do two minute check backs after they drop off our food to see if we need anything. I was out of water and luckily the hostess walked by to take care of us. Also our food took way too long especially for lunch. We will be back for the food and give them an opportunity to step up their service.

It was kinda late for brunch, around 1:30 ish. My friends and I had a long Saturday night and a lazy Sunday morning but we still wanted brunch. Now you can't have brunch without mimosas rights?? 
The minute we got there we all ordered 1 mimosa ($6 bucks). We looked over the menu over and over and over again because we were so damn hungry but nothing stood out to us. Nothing! And it was only about 6 or 7 brunch items on the menu maybe. 

With that being said we asked for or checks for or 1 drink and carried he party over to OSHO

I'm willing to go ahead with 3 stars here, and since I will likely come back again, will gladly update this next time... but this is based on my initial impression from Valentine's Day dinner.  

I was able to snag a table here on Valentine's day via opentable.com. Unfortunately due to my partner being in the hospital the night prior, I had to wait till the last minute to make sure that we were even going to be able to go at all that night.  Gladly we were able to, and given the menu options, I was glad to find a place that we were both able to enjoy.

We arrived about 5 minutes before our scheduled reservation time, and were seated right away.  We were brought to a table on the outdoor patio, which I'm sure was lovely, however, due to my partner's breathing issues, we had to ask to be seated indoors instead.  The host gladly moved us to an indoor table right away, which was appreciated.

Although we were very appreciative that the restaurant let us know right away that there was a delay in the kitchen, we really weren't sure why that was, considering the restaurant wasn't all that crowded.  Given that however, while we did receive our appetizer fairly quickly, the chicken wings were under cooked, and in some cases, partially raw.  Once our entrees arrived, they were luke warm at best. At this point we had been there over an hour, and my partner was not feeling well, so we chose to eat and leave rather than send the food back to be heated up (which would probably have been done by microwave). 

I did enjoy the menu, and we were very interested about their new brunch menu, however, My suggestion would definitely be to keep patrons posted throughout their time there.  Although we were told when we came in, we felt that no one really kept us posted about anything, and then to have luke warm food, makes me think that it was just sitting there for who-knows-how-long until it was finally picked up and brought to us.

A year ago I would been very impressed witha place like this, but even if it is nice.. the space is a little odd, and this type of establishments are a dimje a dozen at this time. This doesn't mean this place is any lesser - it just mean this place might have to step it up to maintin the excellence that it wants to uphold.

I came here as a mingler (is that a word?) and for that purpose the space is far from optimal. Then add a musician that is ok, but way too loud for the space.. which made it incredibly hard to maintain a conversation. Music at this time is background, not the main event. 

Service was awesome though.. a couple of waiters served a group of people that was moving about, and still got every order (to my knowleedge) right - thats impressive. I had some house rum drink that didn't exactly knock my socks off, but then again I consider myself a bit of a rum cognoscente and after that drink I switched to a more low key drink.

I would go back, but maybe not for Happy Hour.. but then again, they might work on it. The atmosphere is nice enough though.
Frequent patron here... Great bar, great service can dine in or take out. Fresh tuna sushi and steaks. Arcadia salad is great.
Amazing drinks and food what more can you ask for!   Outdoor area is amazing! Have been here several times and will always come back - great for an adult atmosphere or family one as well

The whole family's favorite restaurant (kids 12-18). Very cool to think about the restaurant once being a service station. Very comfortable, friendly staff, perfect noise level, and extremely accommodating! 

All 5 of us ordered something different. Cheddar Mac and cheese was tasty. Baked potato was giant and came with more than enough toppings, including pulled pork. I heard the classic pizza was good, but I didn't try it bc my daughter added mushrooms (I am not a mushroom eater). The lemon chicken that looked good in front of another customer  proved itself very good for my entree (sans mushrooms). And my husband asked the chef to create a pizza with BBQ sauce (no tomato), fresh mozzarella, pulled pork and onion straws. It was delicious! Even our server commented on how good it looked! 

The topper was when the server brought out a special birthday dessert for my daughter without singing! She loved it without being too embarrassed! We are in AZ only a few times a year, but we will definitely be eating at Kitchen 56 each time. We can't wait to dine outside there too. We highly recommend this restaurant!!
Horrible service for the 3rd time at the bar..old chicken wings chewy and chewy calamari. bartenders there are rude and indifferent. Never again

Great place. Really come into its own. It started out slow. But has really developed into a great neighborhood place. Nice and easy for families. Great starters. Easy and comfortable service. Comfy seats..... What're could you ask for.
They were out if the appetizer we ordered "Chios & dip" and had been for a week according to our server...the food, pizza, wasn't worth the wait. Won't come back

Great little neighborhood restaurant in Arcadia.  Small menu, great prices, and the perfect warm weather cocktail coolers.  Sit out on the patio and bring your dog for brunch or lunch or enjoy the great happy menu - my wife loves the tacos.  We come here often and consider it our old standby.  Parking can be difficult, but beyond that, a great place.

I pine for the glory days of Kitchen 56 - the happy hours that were the stuff of legend, when a fiver would buy you a dozen of the best wings in the Valley, a Martini that was really just a cup of ice-cold vodka with some stuffed olives, or a heaping plate of fish tacos. The late afternoons when I'd walk over with some coworkers, eat like a king, and gaze at Camelback Mountain looming a stone's throw away (well, a few throws at any rate), and wonder whether all things this good must sooner or later come to an end.

The beginning of the end was the new menu, a little slimmed down and marked by the only price increase that even I found as cute and endearing as it was necessary and irksome: 56 cents. $5.00 became $5.56, $10.00 became - you guessed it - $10.56. I admired their ingenious way of keeping up with inflation, but since then, the menu's undergone a few more drafts, the dozen wings became eight (I think?), a couple of my favorite waiters have moved on, and Kitchen 56 has slipped a little. I still whole-heartedly recommend it for the great patio, spectacular view, casual American fare, fun cocktails, and a few good beer choices. But I hope they find a way to become, once again, what they were for a brief Golden Age: hands-down, the best happy-hour joint in town.

In the meantime, though, go for their pizzas, wings (still absolutely delicious, even if not an incredible value anymore), Kitchen Sink Burger, and anything with Ahi. I'd definitely recommend their lunch and dinner over their brunch (not bad, but there are a half-dozen better brunches in the area). As for cocktails, the Moscow Mule, 56 Martini, Backporch Lemonade, and Elderflower Champagne... heck, they're all delicious!
My first time here and the food was great!  We had a little issue and Jessika and the manager took great care of us to get it solved.  I definitely will be back

I met a few friends there for a casual dinner and it was perfect. I've driven by this place 100 times and was excited to finally check it out! It's cute and simple inside, nothing over the top or super fancy. We started with the pork corn cakes which were delicious. The sauce had a little kick to it, which was was a nice surprise. We also split the bbq pizza and the baked potato. The pizza wasn't anything to write home about, but the potato was delicious! Smothered with more bbq pulled pork and cheese, it was delicious. 

If you're looking for a cute place to grab a casual dinner this is a great place! All the food coming out of the kitchen looked delicious and is affordable. I will definitely be back!

Kitchen 56 what can i say,
Decent food large portions on the sandwiches,
However on the burger the buns could be better
The staff is always friendly if not shorthanded 
Which happens most of the time 
The location of kitchen 56 used to be an old Humble Gas station
And the proprietors of kitchen 56 have done a good job of preserving the old service bays
In side you will  walk in to a artfully decorated establishment, your gaze everywhere from the black and white photos to the wall of fire wood.
A very cool place with a decent happy hour, and good drinks the bartenders know what they are doing.
For all the shorthandeness the staff is very acomadating 
But it can take time to find some aid
Great place in heart of Arcadia!  Nice staff,great american food, and awesome location.  Love this place I go here about 3 times a month.  CHECK IT OUT

Okay it is time fore a quick review.  Just the facts mam.  
I was with my better half and my niece on Saturday.  My better half ordered the hamburger and fries.  She gave it the thumbs up.  My niece ordered the bowl of soup.  It had chicken and mushrooms.  She gave it the two thumbs up too.  I ordered the pork chop.  It was good.  It came with mashed potatoes and a assortment of veggies.  I gave it two thumbs up too.  We did have the pretzels with beer cheese as a appetizer too.  It was good.  I wish the size of the pretzels were a bit larger though.  It was good though.  I do not drink that much anymore.  Did enough for two lifetimes in my twenties.  They have a cool looking drink mixes on the wall too.  I will eventually try the pink panther drink.  I like this place it was our third time here.  It is a drive from where we live.  If we were closer this would be a once a week place.

We've dined here before, so we were surprised with the quality of the food was for this meal.  First, service, staff, and the facility are all A+ - we did not have any alcolol, so we can't judge the bar. The food was flavorless.  We had ordered appetizers and decided not to order dinner once we tried the potato skins and tacos.  We ordered one more app, the chicken tacos, and they we cold and flavorless as well. Our son was hungry, so we ordered the burger (medium well) and it came out just short of mooing.

Kitchen 56 is my new favorite restaurant! Held my birthday party dinner on the patio with a large group of family and friends last night. The food was amazing and Nicole is a wonderful server, effortlessly keeping up with our many orders and special requests. This restaurant luckily reopened a few months ago, and is really hitting the groove with a chic atmosphere and multiple unique seating areas. Thank you to co-owner Andy, manager Ted, and staff for making it a fun and memorable evening! We will be back soon!
Great spot!  Had lunch here today and was delighted. Arcadia salad with grilled salmon. The salmon was a delicious add on. Salad was very good with light lemon vinaigrette. I will order again!

I want to like this place!   I come in about once a month with my parents who live in the area.  The place is cute.   Super comfy bar stools & high tops!   The most amazing chalkboard as a focal point.  Nice patio and open air bar.  Not sure what the food/vibe they are gong for... Local bar? Cafe? Restaurant? Awesome cocktails!  Odd mix of food and a slightly limited menu... But I still dig it and want to really like it! 

The service is a little choppy but they are really nice.. Always! 

The pizza is amazing!  Like really really good.   But I always try something else... Pot pie was underwhelming and lacking enough meat, Caesar salad was solid, Cobb salad was good but the turkey was just sliced deli turkey piled on top (presentation?).  Green chile mac was awesome! Wings were different and cooked well.   I ordered the brussel sprouts hash.  And this is a dish I make at home and love... And I was pretty disappointed with this one.   So much garlic it was actually spicy, I could see the red onions but couldn't taste them over the garlic.   And I love garlic but this was a clear miss.  Bummer.   Please chef!  Taste your food!  Think browned butter and bacon with the shaved sprouts!   Think less garlic...
Great local spot!  Kitchen 56 is a friendly warm neighborhood bar/restaurant. I love their appetizers and selection of beers on tap!  Highly recommend this place, stop and say hi to Ted, he's great!

1st time here and I am really glad I stopped in.  First off, you have amazing views of Camelback mountain.  I sat at the bar and enjoyed a nice glass of their house Zin with my fig and prosciutto wood fired pizza.  It was delicious. There was a guy on guitar singing there as well and he was good and made it lively.  The service was great, very cool vibe and I'll definitely be back! They have a patio on the side but since it's too hot nobody was out there but sure it'll be packed when weather gets nicer! 

I'd definitely recommend this place to others to check out!

I've ate here a few times and have had good experiences each time. The food always tastes fresh and they change up their menu so it's nice to try new entres. I prefer to go during the slow hours because it does get busy.

Accidently missed a turn to go to the Arcadia tavern..ended up here Cuz it looked like a relaxing place. Low and behold it's a hidden gem. I enjoyed the ambience and the relaxing patio. Will come again definitely!

This place used to be a gas station and the building was re-purposed as one of the better eateries on the East Indian School row of restaurants. I've been here for lunch and dinner and the service is always great. The burgers could very well be the best I've ever had. Of course any burger is great when you have a heaping mountain of bacon on it! We have frequent guests that fly in from France for work and we always bring them here after we pick them up from the airport. If the French guys say the food is good it must be great! There's usually a local guy playing covers with his guitar and the outdoor patio has a ping pong table that's fun to burn off some of that bacon.

I have been passing this place since I moved into the valley, so the other day my girlfriend and I wanted to go out and grab something to eat so I figured it would be a good time to try a new place. We looked up the menu online and everything sounded amazing and was prices well. The bartender was also our server and recommended some good dishes, he was very nice and knowledgable about the menu. I would definitely go back to eat here!!

Took a walk today along the canal and found this restaurant.  It was pretty good.  I had a proscutto and fig panini with fries.  It was pretty good.  They also have happy hour all day on Sunday for drinks only.  Food specials start later in the afternoon.

What can I say but awesomeness about this place.

Had a table of 6, as we normal sit at the bar area, wings, wings, wings are the Best thing on the menu. If you get them trust me they won't let you down.

This place os like a home away from home and love visiting when ever I'm in town.

My fiancée and I came back on Sunday for a carry out of the wings.....This place rocks even with the carry out orders. Don't sleep on K56, you can even bring your 4 legged friends on the patio while wnjoying the Fall weather.

I love the history of this building.  The huge photo in the dining room shows the building when it was used as a gas station.  I was expecting a lot from the food and drink and was a little disappointed.  

The edamame is amazing.  Splashed with a soy-oyster sauce mix, it was huge enough for four people to share.  The salad I ordered was fine.  Nothing to gush about.  My companions, including one picky kid, LOVED their burgers and omelets.  The fries were undercooked, cold inside and inedible.

The "adult lemonade" drinks sounded interesting, but the one I ordered (cucumber-basil) was so horrible I could barely take more than a few sips before abandoning it.  My companion also ordered one, a different flavor, and agreed that it was not good.

Despite the history of the building, the food was bland and uninspiring.

Our server was great!  The place looks fun as you drive by. 

However, when you walk inside it's bright lights create an odd ambience.  Perhaps I'm used to nicer more upscale places and also funky dives, but this falls in the middle. Kind of like Applebee's without the charm - sarcasm. I think the interior is terrible and nondescript.  

Our martinis were over priced and served tepid. We had expressly asked for them to be ice cold and our server acted as if she knew what we meant. The bartender obviously doesn't drink martinis. Never order a mixed drink in a family restaurant!!!!!

The hamburgers were fine but nothing special. The French fries were the best part of the meal. Couldn't wait to leave - will never return. The pizza at the next table looked good.

I normally don't bother writing anything when I'm not happy about an experience, but this is necessary. For starters, the service was atrocious. We waited two hours for our meals and the manager never bothered to come talk to us. I had to chase her down three times. When the food came, my chicken was still cold and raw, my wife got sick from her salmon. They forgot half of our meals and had nothing to say except "I don't know what's going on". I wouldn't eat there again if it was free. Sad because it's in my hood. Everyone was excited, but the reviews from friends match mine.  My guess is that it won't survive the summer.

My wife and I have been back to Kitchen 56 several times as it is local but it keeps disappointing. The service is great and the drinks are well made but the food is well below par and leaves a lot to be desired. The burgers and pizzas are ok but anything over and above this that requires a little more cooking skill is average at best. The pot pie is completely lacking in flavor and the short rib tastes like it comes out a package. We'll maybe stop in for a drink again but will seek food elsewhere!

Once again we begrudgingly go to 56 since the decline of their food but we go bc the kids love it and we walk to an empty restaurant and we're told they have an hour wait. With a ton of available tables- and yet open table tells me I can get a table in 10 mins. This has happened the last two times we have gone. So done with here.

This place hits the spot across the board!  Excellent service, delicious food with ample portions and overall cool ambiance!  

From the host stand to the servers to the bartenders to the manager on staff, everyone was delightful, helpful and accommodating without being pushy, annoying or interrupting our convo.

Amazing happy hour menu, lovely craft beers on tap, extensive wine list and they make a mean martini!

I love the adaptive re-use of an old service station and how that's incorporated into the overall vibe of the place and the retro brand.  Great job there, Kitchen 56!

Next time I'm I must try their famous burgers (my table-mates raved like religious zealots over them!) and I need to check out the patio for some solid "hang out" time. I mean, that's why we live in the desert, right?

I'll definitely be back and with a pack of friends!

This place is awesome - cool location and history, and really unique and delicious food. Our server was great and we had no wait or any issues at all. I can't wait to come back when it's cooler out to sit and drink on the outdoor patio. 

I had the Arcadia salad and others in my party had pizzas. We all ordered unique drinks and everyone was pleased. 

This place is a very cool find on the Phx/Scottsdale border that definitely satisfies anyone looking for great food and a non-chain atmosphere.

Kitchen 56 became my new regular spot once I found it.  I often drove by, but had some other regular watering holes and never stopped in.  One night I went with some girl friends and never looked back! 

I lived in Boise Idaho for several years, and brand 44 North Huckleberry vodka was local to Idaho.  I searched high and low for bars in Phoenix that had 44 North and i was absolutely delighted when I found it on the menu of Kitchen 56! 

I can not recommend their happy hour enough. Smokin deals - 5 street tacos for $5.56? YES PLEASE.  I also ALWAYS ordered their Brussels spout hash.  My favorite meals were by far the Ahi Tuna entree and the Short Ribs.  The burgers/sandwiches were mediocre, so stay away from those if you are looking for a true food experience.

I give only 4 stars because occasionally their service was lacking, often as a result of being short staffed.  And while their menu had stellar stand outs in my opinion, some items were a little lacking. Ted, the general manager, was great and made sure folks were enjoying their experience.  

I would definitely recommend this place over the other local eateries that were often over crowded.  The live music on Sundays and Wednesdays was also a great touch!

I went here for lunch, there wasn't much to choose from (very small lunch menu)  and when we did get a salad and sandwich (30 min later)  to share, both of us were very disappointed with the amount of food that we received and it was COLD! (panini and fries). Only giving this place a 2 because of its ambiance....

Very limited menu, but the service and food are both good. I just wish there were more options. I was cornered into a salad, which was great, but the bowls are weird and make it hard not to get your lettuce all over your table.
Service was bad but the food was worse. I was so optimistic after the remodel that some things would change but now they are understaffed, way behind with the food, and it was cold.

Fun atmosphere. I got a Moscow mule and it was the best one I've ever had! I got an Arcadia salad and it was so yummy! I wish that prices were a little bit better- I wanted to add chicken to my salad but it would have been $4 more. I didn't feel like paying $15 for a salad. Bur other than that, I was very pleased.

Totally disappointed on so many levels with this place.  I went there last night  excited to finally try the place since I drive past it on my way to and from work everyday.  When it is all lit up at night it just seems so inviting.  I was meeting a friend to talk business and we arrived a bit before 830. 
My experience started off bad and just went downhill from there.  When we walked in all the booths were taken but none of the tables in the dining room nor the 2 tables along the back wall that each seat 6 but have the comfy booth seats on one side.  We asked to be seated there but was told they needed to keep them open in case a large party came in.  Seriously?   It was a Wednesday night at 830, there would have been plenty of seating if a party larger than our meager 2 top came in.  Strike 1.
Next our server Lissa did come by quickly to ask if we wanted to order, we asked for a few minutes.  I also asked what the soup of the day was, butternut squash, mmmmm! Those few minutes turned into more than a few and another server asked if we needed anything and ended up taking our order.  I ordered the soup and tuna tartar.  Lissa then came back to the table to inform us that they were out of the soup of the day.  Strike 2.  I order a side of vegetables instead.
Lissa refills my water glass, brownie points for that, but spills some not only on the table but my hand.  She doesn't apologize, clean it up, nothing, just walks away.  Strike 3.
My companion gets the edamame, which were not bad but the bowl that they were served in had a serious chip on the rim.  It was bad enough to cut someone if you weren't careful.  Strike 4.
My tuna tartar was pretty terrible, a few chunks of chewy fish that were somewhat grey in color hidden among some greens that had way to many capers which made it super salty,  I ate a little less than half of it because I was so hungry and didn't want to deal with sending it back.  Strike 5.
Next up the sorry ass, poor excuse for a side of vegetables,  When Lissa set down in front of me this tiny dish with wilted spinach and 1 piece of squash that was quartered and 1 piece of zucchini that was quartered I couldn't believe it.  There was a layer of spinach water at the bottom and it tasted like it was seasoned with Mrs. Dash.  Again I ate it because I was starving but realizing that each bite basically cost me a dollar, it was 5 bucks. Strike 6.
Not even done yet......
At 9:30 Lissa asks us if we want anything else, my companion informs her that her boyfriend will be joining us in a few minutes to get some dinner.  We are informed that the kitchen is closed.  There were still people in the place and from what I gathered from the website the kitchen closes "when the party is over."  So now my companion is on Yelp trying to find another place to go meet him so he can eat,  Strike 7.
She finds a place not far and is going to meet her man by 10 because we still had some business to discuss.  I said she could just go so he didn't have to wait but always the professional, she stayed so we could wrap up our meeting.
At 945 some people walk in, are seated and given menus.  I ask the server that helped them, a very nice gentleman, if they were going to be eating because we were told the kitchen was closed.  He went and checked and apologized for the mix-up but the kitchen was still open.  Strike 8. 
 I wish that guy was our server because he was great. I also see him speak to Lissa, who glances at our table but she never comes over herself to apologize.  I think she was in a hurry to clock out.  Strike 9
When Lissa brings us our bill, the soup that they were out of, was still on it.  When I point this out to her she states since I got the side of vegetables, which wasn't on the bill, she just left the soup in place of it.  First, from a management prospective, you have to keep track of everything that is served to figure out your food and production cost.  Second, it was just plain laziness to not correct the bill.  Strike 10.
Furthermore the soup was 7 and the vegetables 5, a cost difference that I pointed out to her.  She said she would take care of it.  She brings back the bill and say, "Ok they took a dollar off."  Are you kidding me?!  You can't subtract 5 from 7?!  Strike 11.
I am so done with this place at this point I leave a chintzy $5 tip, I really wanted to leave nothing, but the old school server in me wouldn't allow it.  I left feeling cheated out of $70 and will never go back.

Yes, yes, yes kitchen 56 has finally reopened with a brand new elegant look and the same exquisite food. Went there yesterday had the best burger in town  and the French fries are to die for, the icing on the cake is that my favourite waiter has opened back up with them, Alex you are the best , You give impeccable service and make the whole experience of kitchen 56 fun , can't wait to go back and would recommend this great place to everyone .
Awesome place.   Nice waitstaff.   We started off with the chips and dip, so good.   Followed with two burgers.    Very delicious.  We will definitely be visiting again... And again.  :)
Just OK- food isn't great but isn't terrible. Not my favorite place in this part of town.

Was really wanting to love this place but was disappointed.  Ordered the blue cheese crusted steak and the meat was so tough it was inedible. The steak seemed to have been cooked a bit more rare than medium so I was surprised the meat was as tough as a shoe.  Our waiter was great and replaced it with a burger and although not bad it wasn't anything special. 

They have a very limited dinner menu, the restaurant was empty on a Saturday night so not much of an ambiance.  

Their fries were delicious and customer service was good. The cocktail menu seemed original, but I wasn't able to drink that night. Maybe I'd go back just to try drinks, but not interested in eating there again.

Let me start off by saying the the staff and our  server Sydney are exceptional they are so friendly and nice, but something has happened to this place. The food has just gone done. Not sure if theirs a new chef or new owners. Kind of a bummer.

This place is really sweet. Went in on a Sunday before I had to get to work and my salad came out almost immediately. Almost passed it by but noticed the parking lot was full. The bartenders name is Mike and he gave awesome service! Definitely coming back!

This is one of those places I sort of hate to give a lukewarm review to, because they are trying hard and people have clearly put a lot of work into making the restaurant nice...but the food is mediocre and it's sort of on the pricey side. I came here for a work lunch and the place was on the quieter side, so that's good. I ordered the veggie sandwich ($12.56) and it was just a bad grilled cheese. The chipotle aioli didn't taste very good (and I like chipotle cream sauces) and there was so much of it that the sandwich bread slid around. The cheese wasn't very good. The vegetables in it were fine but nothing too exciting. The person I was eating with got the steak salad and I thought the salad size was...small. Too small to make a lunch of.

Overall, I think it's just a little too expensive for what you get especially since there are so many great restaurants that are also pricey but have yummier food for me in the area. But the restaurant area is nice and it probably would be fun for happy hour.

Bomb HH! Was pleasantly surprised. Nice dog friendly patio, friendly service, and yummy appetizers and drinks at happy hour. We will definitely be back! Get the calamari and the chicken tacos. Oh and the edamame for a veggie.

I've been meaning to check this place out for quite some time, but previous reviews weren't exactly motivating. We went for dinner on a Thursday night and we were immediately seated by a friendly hostess. The decor is really nice inside and fits their overall theme well. We started with some drinks. I had the jalapeño margarita and my wife had a bourbon/apple cocktail, and both were great.
