For dinner, I ordered the green chili burger with fries, and it was one of the best burgers I've had in a long time. My wife ordered the kale salad and really enjoyed it as well. We will definitely be back to try some of the other stuff on the menu.

We came here on Saturday with our dogs and it was perfect! Staff was attentive and didn't give us a hassle about asking to move into the shade. They even brought out extra water for the pups. 

Onion dip was spot on as well as the burgers! I love a good Bloody Mary which could have had a little spice to it but overall satisfied with our visit!
Food...ambiance...service...parking...price...EVERYTHING DOUBLE GREAT.  Loved it and can't wait to go back.
Ben coming here for years.........service going down hill.............food only OK.............great bartender...............

Came here for the first time to celebrate a work friend's "workiversary." The patio is very enjoyable, large, and sunny. We arrived near noon and the place wasn't very busy. However, it seemed to take a long time to get our drinks and place our order. I believe that there was only 1 server taking all the orders for our group of 10, which did not seem to scream "good planning." But, our server kept her cool and didn't show her frustration when one of my party pulled the "high maintenance" card out and requested several variations to her lunch selection. Kudos to you, cool headed server! 

My veggie sandwich was ok. It didn't have a lot of flavor. The veggies were fresh enough, but the overall impression was rather bland. The fries, though, were great. My colleagues appeared to enjoy their selections, so perhaps only the veggie sandwich needed a flavor boost.

I'd check out Kitchen 56 again to see what their other menu selections are like. I really like the patio and can see myself enjoying happy hour.

Dog friendly patio, great happy hour, walking distance from our house, great service, and delicious eats + drinks? Yes, please! Kitchen 56 is a major winner in my book! The service is always very friendly and attentive! From 3-6 PM on weekdays they have a variety of $5.56 eats and drinks! 

I ordered their kale + quinoa salad for lunch {add chicken} and it was incredible! It was a VERY hearty salad and I was super full by the end of it! It is hard to find a good, hunger satisfying salad these days and Kitchen 56 definitely does not disappoint!

The fiance had the green chili burger and loved it, but I loved the hand-cut fries even more!!! They were so yum {sorry Ben P. for stealing most of them!}. ;) He secretly orders fries because he knows I love them {insert awwwwwww here}. 

We'll be back to this fab restaurant in the 'hood very soon! Thanks for always being so great! Harvey {our sheepdog} loves the treats and cozy patio as well!

Arrived and waited a long time for our lunch and the place was not even full.  So for Mac and Cheese which was ok, the green chili burger and fries, dessert and one drink with tip...$38!!!  All I can say is that there is no way my lunch was worth that much money. The place is very nicely decorated, parking can be a pain, but the food was not something special.
Go here. Get a pizza and their loaded baked potato. You can die happily after.

First visit was a Friday "Really Happy Hour". $5.56 for the best adult lemonade in Phoenix! The Back Porch and Green Tea Lemonades were perfection. 

The homemade chips and summer salsa(also $5.56) was a perfect compliment to the lemonade.

Kitchen 56 is a neighborhood restaurant with a full bar located in the Arcadia area of Phoenix.  It came highly recommended to me by some of my neighbors.  My first impression upon walking into the restaurant was very good.  I love the casual, clean décor and the place just has a nice neighborhood feel to it.  I was greeted immediately and was seated without delay. I was there for a late brunch or lunch on a Sunday. The place was not busy at all.  There were a couple of people at the bar and two other tables inside were occupied.  I know they have a patio but I did not venture so I don't know how many people were there but there were not many cars in the parking lot.

My waiter came over and took my drink order within a couple of minutes of me being seated and then took my brunch order when he brought my drink.  He was pleasant, had the expected smile however, he never introduced himself so I have no idea what his name is.

I ordered the ginger spritzer for a drink and the three cheese & basil omelet with fruit and potatoes for my brunch order. The order took a little longer then I would expect for an omelet on a not-so-busy day but I took that as a good sign thinking the chef was just preparing everything fresh and with care. 

After the waiter delivered my food, he was never to be seen again!  I was also wrong about the expected quality of the omelet.  This was probably the most poorly prepared omelet I have ever had.  Even one of those breakfast-chain restaurants does a better job.  The omelet was over-cooked, there was no sign of any basil in the omelet and it was extremely salty.  The fruit consisted of a dry orange wedge and one average strawberry.  I did find the basil, it was on the potatoes which were also too salty but otherwise cooked well.

I thought about complaining and probably should have.  But I figured my waiter would stop by soon to ask if everything was okay. No waiter.  After several minutes the owner stopped by and asked, my reply was "Do you really want to know?" I told her it was salty and there was no basil in the omelet.  She went back to the kitchen and then offered a free desert which I declined. She then offered to re-make the omelet but I declined that also as I was short on time.

I have to say, she was very apologetic, sincere and pleasant to talk with.  Based solely on her pleasantness and attitude along with my neighbor's recommendation, I will give this place a second chance but there are some obvious issues that she must resolve with her wait and cook staff.  It's a shame that this happened at a restaurant with SO MUCH potential in an up-scale neighborhood. It is these kinds of things that will make or break an independent, neighborhood restaurant.

My check was presented to me by the owner (again, not the waiter) and she only charged me for my drink.  I was grateful and told her she really didn't need to comp the food, so I paid for the drink and about  1/2 of what the omelet should have been. I will go back sometime although Kitchen 56 is not on my priority list right now.  I will hope for better service and food up to the standards of such a nice place.
I wish the food was better because the location is great...unfortunately both the food and drinks are overpriced and just mediocre at best.

I agree with other reviews -- mediocre and underwhelming. The wine choices are bottom shelf and overpriced. They serve the wine at warmer than room temp as well. The food is just okay, but not worth the trip. There are much better options a little further west on Indian School.
We're off to a good start. Skin-on fries and a Philly Cheese Steak for my first visit.

Meh! =I 
Totally neutral is how I left Kitchen 56.  We arrived with reservations and were promptly sat at a high top table in the middle of the restaurant. I was surprised to see It was pretty busy for 8PM on a Friday.  Our server greeted us very briefly and took Hottie's drink order (I wanted to look over the menu) and then left. He seemed pretty frazzled.  About 5 minutes later our drinks were dropped off by someone else, who did not ask if we needed anything.  Another 5 Minutes pass and a female server comes to our table and asks if we are ready to order. No, "Hi my name is"... "let me tell you about the menu", nothing!  I told her I would like to order a drink and she seemed annoyed, like I was being rude.  She took my drink order and our appetizer order and left.  

We started with the Onion straws, a little greasy but overall pretty tasty especially because the sauce was fantastic.  For my cocktail I had a Maple Manhattan, which was so delicious one of the best Manhattan's I've had.  

 For dinner I ordered their tofu and vegetable stir fry with Soba Noodles. This had received good reviews from fellow yelpers so I was excited to try it.  I was greatly disappointed. The noodles were over cooked, it had no flavor except ginger and there were no vegetables in it except red cabbage.  I never send anything back, but I did. This of course took about 10 minutes, because our server never came back to check on us. I flagged down a manager and she suggested the green chili macaroni.  By the time this came out, Hottie had already finished his meal and his plate had been taken. This kind of kills the dining experience.  When the macaroni came out, it was much better, great flavor and just the right amount of creaminess and spice. Again the noodles were a little over cooked; they were breaking apart, but still edible. 

Overall, the service was pretty poor, but being a former Server I could tell that they were all "In the weeds" so I gave her a break, and still left a 30% tip.  The food was good, but not great.  I think I would try Kitchen 56 again under the right circumstances, but with so many other options in the area, it won't be anytime soon.

Decent enough food.   Although the edamame alone is worth the trip.   That was really the standout for me.    The cocktail menu is varied and great.  Love the cucumber mule.  The waitstaff was excellent and very knowledgeable about every aspect of the menu.

Stopped in for a casual dinner last night and ordered the calamari to start ($8) it was coated in a peanut slaw eh wasn't quite my thing. I m not into foods overly sauced. I would pick something diff next time. I opted for the Arcadia salad- mixed greens with cranberries and pecans with a citrus vinaigrette. I added chix for protein. It was very clean, fresh and exactly what I wanted. The menu is simple from pastas, pizzas, burgers, salads. i would go back and check it out again but wouldn't recc to drive here if you dint live in the neighborhood.

This was our third time here. Our first experience was great- that was last summer. Our second experience was last fall. I had asked if I could substitute the French fries that came on the side of my steak for a different vegetable. The server said I could only sub a salad, which was already the second side that came with the dish at the time. While I like salads, if I wanted that much I would have ordered a salad. 
We went again tonight in the hopes that things would have improved. We made a reservation on Open Table. The hostess said they had reserved a table in the bar. Really? I asked if we could sit In the dining room instead. At least she said alright because the bar was quite noisy. 
We ordered calamari to start. Then when it came to entrees I got the short ribs and my boyfriend got the baby back ribs. The calamari took a long time to come out. The table behind us got really quick, friendly service. When the entrees came out, all of our sides were mixed up. The runner asked if that was OK. Really? Um...no. He should have offered to re-plate it in the kitchen. Instead, we had to swap stuff around at the table, which was messy. I mean, who wants to try to scoop mashed potatoes to a different play with a fork and knife? Then our server came by and asked if everything was OK. We said that they screwed up the plates and she proceeded to show us her ticket where she wrote it down right, and blamed the kitchen. Still, no apology or anything. 
To top it off, the table behind us got a free dessert from their server just for being flirty. Not that I wanted a free dessert. All I wanted was some customer service. 
And there was a fly that simply wouldn't leave us alone once our food came. 
Sorry, I'm going to give this place a pass next time it is suggested. There are better places in the area. 
Oh yeah- that reservation we made on Open Table? It was cancelled by the restaurant after we left. Guess I won't be getting those points. Thanks, but no thanks, Kitchen 56.

Kitchen 56! How have I managed to miss this little gem? Loved it! Started with the chips and onion dip, a classic, paper thin, fresh chips and creamy onion dip, what's not to love? Our party ordered the pulled pork sandwich, burger deluxe, and the arugula and fennel salad, all excellent and prepared to perfection. HAD to order the brussel sprout hash, as I love brussel sprouts, and figured it would either be very bad or very good...delightfully, it was the latter! Fresh and savory, a perfect side. For desert we order several to sample, creme brûlée with fig reduction, deep fried banana split (was that homemade ice cream?) and made to order zeppoles with sugar and cinnamon. Phenomenal. Start to finish it was a great night. David was our server and he was fabulous, I'm a stickler for good service, it can make or break a restaurant for me, and he was impressive. I will absolutely be back, can't believe it has taken me so long to make it in!

I love places that adventure with basics. It's like planning a camping trip and instead of packing a cot, you managed to get a massaging bed up the mountain. Ok real terrible analogy, but basically, the traditional method works and does the job, but sometimes you want a little more. 

This place had great ideas, but I just didn't love it. I ordered the pretzels for an app, with the beer cheese. The pretzels were loaves, which I should have guessed meant they weren't the super chewy things I love to eat. Not to say they were bad, but just ok. The cheese sauce I did totally love though, and I may or may not have licked that bowl clean. Discreetly of course. 

I also ordered a side of brussel sprout hash and while the texture and the cooking process of these delightful veggies was spot on, they needed something else. Some pizazz. They underwhelmed me, which was sad. 

For our entree, we got the steak and blue cheese pizza. Again, great idea, less than amazing execution. I couldn't taste any blue cheese at all. None. Nada. And it really needed that zip. Without the tang it was kinda like a quesadilla with a sprinkle of steak and mushrooms. I didn't get the garlic taste at all either and to continue there is maybe a light smattering of steak on this thing, so if you are feeling meaty skip it. The mushrooms do help on that department, but not enough. The crust was good, I did like that.

And lastly, I got a raspberry mojito. I love love love mojitos, so refreshing and not too sweet. Well this one was sour. Whew. It had real raspberries (not sure if fresh or frozen) which were mega tart. It was palatable but a little tough to enjoy wholeheartedly. 

The atmosphere was great. I love that. I love the visit and story and the service was great. Just a little more love on the food. I want to taste that extra bit.

What happened to this place?  Came in for breakfast on a Saturday, patio was filthy.  Only one other table, server took forever, please don't make us come find you!

Some lady brought her dog and a huge blanket that she shaked and spread out for the dog.  Maybe consider a separate patio?  We didn't care for the dog hair all over us and our food.

Breakfast was average, not good.   The dirty patio experience was enough for us.
We won't be back.

Came here twice on my jaunt up to Phoenix.  Once for dinner and once for brunch. Creative menu for dinner, enthusiastic wait person and vibrant space. Baked potato was cold. They brought a new one that was hot. It was very filling though wasn't what I expected. It was missing the buttery component and was more a pulled pork over potatoes dish. Satisfying though
Brunch was disappointing. Menu items lacked meat components. Waitress told me the black beans in the 56 Scramble were funky. So I ordered the biscuits and gravy. The dish was unappetizingly served. A kind of white vomit.  A sprig of something would help. Biscuit was dry and not incorporating well. I ordered bacon side which was not on menu she asked if I liked it crispy I said yes. I got a huge wad of stuck together bacon. It was greasy and low grade. I felt sick immediately. My teeth are still covered in grease
This place needs to work on their signature dishes and increase consistency and quality of product.  It's a nice environment with friendly staff.

My wife and I stopped by here on Sunday for lunch and loved the atmosphere and patio, however things went a bit downhill from here. Our server Shae (?) was great but the lunch was a bit off. The pretzel app was great and the lunch went down from there. The burgers were cooked well enough however there was more bun than burger and the bun was burnt. When Shae came to check on us I can't help but think she saw the burnt bread as we had set it aside. The drinks were good enough but the cinnamon in my wife's  drink was either absent or just not enough. We will be back and hopefully the buns won't be burnt and the burger will fit the bread

Stopped in for lunch today with high hopes. My husband & I have been wanting to check this place out. We started out with the chips & dip. It was just okay, the dip to me tasted like french onion soup mix and the chips (while made in house) were somewhat bland. For lunch, I ordered the green mac & cheese and my husband had the chicken firebread. Our entrees took about 40 minutes even though they seemed to be quite slow. Not one to give up on a place when they may just be having a bad day I was hoping that I'd be impressed enough with our meals to return. That was not the case. 

My mac & cheese was good, but was cold when it got to the table. If I'm waiting 40 minutes for a meal it should be hot when it arrives. It was something I'd try again, but since we won't be going back I guess I'll have to find my mac & cheese elsewhere.

Besides also being cold, my husband's firebread HAD A HAIR IN IT! Definitely not okay. When we informed our waitress she didn't seem fazed, she simply offered to get him something else. When he told her he didn't want to wait another 40 minutes she rudely replied that she had coursed our meal out & didn't have them fire the entrées until we were done with our appetizer. Which would have been fine if true, but it took us maybe 10 minutes to eat our chips & dip. So I doubt our entrées took 30 minutes.

Overall we were severely disappointed & won't be back. Seems like a cool place to drink though...

Loved this place before they started their remodel. Went back for the first time since reopening and was sadly disappointed. The service was atrocious. We called ahead and asked made a reservation and they gave us some push back at first, understandable because it was a Saturday night, but when we got arrived, there may have been only two other parties in the restaurant (other then the bar). We were greeted right away and they we waited about 5-7 minutes to be seated. Once again, the place was empty. Once seated we ordered and everything was relatively smooth. We ordered the calamari for an appetizer and if it had a rating alone it would be a 1 star. Perhaps the worst I've had in the phx-Scottsdale-West coast area. 45min-1hr later we finally got our food. This is where the 3 star comes in. The pulled pork sandwich was great. Can't complain one bit about other than I wish I would have ordered two of them. After finishing our meals, we yet again waited an eternity to get the bill. Needless to say, we probably won't be running back to this place anytime soon.
This is definitely one of my new favorite places in Phoenix...very cool, open space, awesome happy hour prices, amazing food, and great service at the bar!
lovely local spot!  i wish we had something like this near our home.  good food great atmosphere, friendly place.

My co workers and I have a payday Friday tradition where we pick a new place to eat lunch that's considered cool/hip/trendy.  Today's vote was for kitchen 56.  

We walked in and the smell of a wood burning oven was a nice welcomeing scent.  It had a nice open floor plan and didn't make you feel cramped at all while eating in the dining room.

I ordered one of the firebread sandwiches which was like a flatbread type sandwich.  I got the Steak.  When it came out it came with a salad and I asked for fries to which they promptly brought out a large plate of fries which the whole table then got to enjoy.  the steak was a little tough to chew through and not quite the best cut to put on a sandwich but the flavor was great and the bread was super fresh and soft.

all in all had a nice experience and will be back for sure
It was okay had been going there since they opened but things have kinda gone south on k 56 pricing way over priced and the staff lacked personality now I remember why we quit going

First time at Kitchen 56.  We ordered the Chilaquiles and a Beet Salad from the Brunch Menu; and although the taste of our food was VERY good, the portion size of the Beet Salad left us a bit hungry.  

I am not a fan of portion sizes that are so big that half the food is either thrown away and wasted or is unhealthy for an average sized adult, but the $13.56 "side salad" sized Beet Salad almost seemed insulting.   They could have at least bulked it up with more greens, but this salad had almost no bulk whatsoever.  My husband was completely finished with his salad before I had even finished half of my $9.56 chilaquiles, which was not a huge portion either, but was plenty.  

I'll come back again and try something else, and might have to just speak up if I'm served a child sized meal again.

I'm sorry Kitchen 56 - I'm not in love. I went here a couple of weeks ago with friends for dinner. The service was fine, the atmosphere nice but the food was just...ok. I had one of the pizzas and a salad. My friends both seemed to enjoy their meals but no rave reviews. I had the same feeling that I had a Beckett's Table - lots of hype but it missed the mark for me.
I love this place-- the ambiance, the building, the drinks...and the green chili mac and cheese! What a lovely neighborhood spot.

First time here on my birthday.  Love that they let me use my free appetizer and free dessert on the same visit.  Great Happy Hour menu with too die for chicken wings.  A great spicy and zesty taste to them.  The Arcadia salad is light and filling (probably because I ate 7 chicken wings before).  But seriously very good flavor.  Side of green chile mac n cheese which you can get as a meal was good but could have used a bit more of a kick.  

Love the history of the building and like that it is not very noisy.

Service was friendly and food was good. Ordered dessert and wasn't told that the freezer was down so the ice cream wouldn't be included. Then, no break on price despite the dessert missing that element.

Ok, we eat here almost every week!

The food is great (I've had exactly one item I wouldn't order again)...the burgers are top notch, the pizzas very good, the salads exceptional...I could go on and on...

The staff is awesome, really friendly and attentive. The owner is a sweetheart.

It's just a great local place...and definitely try the calamari, it's outstanding!

We drive by this place everyday and finally decided to drop-in for dinner. MISTAKE. In both entrees the meat tasted old (chicken) or rancid (pork). It was literally disgusting and inedible. I will never go back.

We are new to town and stopped in for happy hour.  The cocktails were great.  We had the wings, which were cooked perfectly, and a nicely presented bruschetta as well.  Several days later I returned for lunch with my daughter and we had a hamburger and Philly cheesesteak.  The homemade potato chips are sinful and was more than the two of us could eat.  We also stopped in for brunch and everything was spot on.  Nice local place to get consistently good food and gracious service.

We decided to try this place since we drive by here on our way to our scottsdale office all the time. The ambiance is really nice.. its a very cute restaurant. The menu seemed interesting but we were both disappointed in our food. The soup and the meals both lacked any flavor. The salad dressing was the most flavorful thing on the plate. I had a nice chunk of some black plastic in my chicken salad wrap. I was done eating after discovering that. The server never came to check on us after taking our order until he came to pick up the plates. Upon letting him know about the plastic he just said oh, do you want something else? ... well i might have.... 20 minutes ago. then we waited another 10 minutes for our check and the manager to come over and explain that my entree had been removed from the check.  I would hope so. I don't think we'll be returning. Typically food can save poor service but neither were impressive.

There's a reason it's barely 3.5 stars.  Came in at 6 - though we struggled for parking and then walked in high degree weather, seats were available, "there was a wait."  We've been here before and the food is not great, but can pass when you're hungry.  The "homemade" bread is greasy and incredibly too big.  It's a great place to have a "poured" drink, but nothing that you would expect a true bartender to know... Keep driving to downtown Scottsdale...

Kitchen 56 is a comfortable place to have a meal with drinks. I meet some friends here that are regulars so we did get excellent table service.

I had the Pork Chop served on top of mashed potatoes with red cabbage served on the side. The meal was about $15, a heck of a lot more than you would pay at a Lone Star Restaurant. I thought there was nothing really special about the Pork Chop, it just didn't have that succulent juicy taste that I have come to expect from a Pork Chop. The mashed potatoes and red cabbage were just ok for me.

I have heard that Kitchen 56 has great Happy Hour food specials. So I would probably return if in the area during Happy Hour.

I finally made the short trip to Kitchen 56 for lunch yesterday. Seeing as the overall rating sits at a comfortable 3.5 stars, I was never in any sort of rush to get here.

As I usually like to do, I went ahead and found a good seat at the bar to grab a drink and some food. The menu reads very straight forward and the selection is somewhat limited for brunch and lunch options, which isn't always so bad. After some debate I settled on the Green Chili Angus Burger and a Black Cherry 'Adult' Lemonade.

The drink came out and it was fine -  nothing too special about it, but it was refreshing and did it's job as a nice easy to drink cocktail. The burger was pretty uninspired. Yeah it had poblanos and pepperjack on it, but there wasn't even the slightest kick to it and I had to put some of my side salad on it to give it a little more flavor of some kind. I ordered medium, it came out medium-well....and so the story goes, an overall 'so-so' experience.

The service at the bar was good and attentive, the decor is nice, but the food isn't going to blow your socks off at all. I didn't come rushing into this place to begin with, and probably won't be rushing back.

I love Kitchen 56.  Love.

A friend suggested this place for happy hour one afternoon, and I'm so glad she did.  I'd heard of the place but knew nothing about it, so before we met, I looked at their website and made a mental list of the things I wanted to try.  None disappointed!

First of all, the place is adorable.  It wasn't at all what I expected, but I loved what it ended up being.  From the outside, the place looked simple and welcoming.  Inside, it's open and casual, and decorated really nicely, from a large mural to fun wall decor.  Seating was available at the bar, tables, or booths by the windows.

Upon learning it was my first visit, the server assigned to my table was welcoming and enthusiastic and was quick to recommend drinks and menu items.  My first drink was one of their signature adult lemonades - the black cherry.  It was ridiculously delicious from first sip to the last few amarena cherries left in the bottom of the glass.  I could have easily enjoyed a few of these drinks, especially since they didn't taste like they had alcohol in them!  I had the pink panther next, and while I enjoyed it, it wasn't nearly as good as the first.  Since I was two drinks in, I decided a bit of food would be a good idea, so I tried the black bean dip with tortilla chips off the happy hour menu (it seems to have rotated off the menu, sadly!).  It was SO GOOD and I was disappointed when we finished it.  For dinner, I went with the griddled corn cakes topped with pulled pork.  This was the best thing I'd eaten in a long time!  It was served with two sauces, both of which perfectly complemented the flavors of the corn and pork.  Definitely my favorite.

There's nothing I didn't like about this place, except maybe that it wasn't closer to my home.  I look forward to visiting again and again!

We have tried this place twice.  Our first visit was on our anniversary when we were served a bottle of the Emeritus Pinot warm.  The bar tender tried to remedy the situation by putting the bottle in a chiller.   Not a place for wine lovers like ourselves.

We came back last night and had a terrible experience.  We ordered the Emeritus Pinot again.  Fortunately it was properly served :). We orders the steak frites for dinner (my favorite) and were served a steak salad.  We sent the salads back .  I kid you not, the kitchen scraped the steak off, added some frites and served It to us cold.  Pathetic.  We sent it back.   The manager came out and offered  us free dessert, never mind that we hadn't eaten anything for dinner....We were not at Denny's (although I wish we were), a brownie doesn't make it all better...we paid for the wine, left and went to Humble Pie.   I don't think we will give this place a third try.

Cute, friendly, yummy, Arcadia neighborhoody place to eat and drink. Thank you for a good selection of draft beer and things to eat. It's very clean and simple- and casual, yet classy! I've been here twice and I look forward to entertaining my peeps at this place.

Good service, good comfortable setting BUT
food was not so good.
I had the chips & dip - not bad
my entree was the green chili mac
the waitress said this had a little kick

The only kick was me kicking myself in the ass for ordering this bland tasteless product

Total cost before tip
$20.50

My friends and I went for a girlie lunch and had a great time. The food was excellent...it's cinco de mayo so the special was fish tacos and they were awesome. My friends had other dishes and we all agreed that we were in love...it's fabulous supporting a local business and Kitchen 56 did not dissapoint!

Only needed one visit to wash out the memories of mediocrity from the failed Vatra experiment.  The place has a casual ambiance that better fits the neighborhood.  Their tempura battered tofu and noodles is a dish that could make me a 4 day a week vegetarian.  Good spot that hopefully can continue to grow into its potential.

Good decor and relaxed atmosphere.  Service was excellent - very friendly, engaging and attentive.  

Had tomato basil soup to start which was quite good, and not served too hot.  Pulled pork sandwich was great, but the Kobe burger was better.  Will definitely be coming back.

I have finally decided how to handle the 1/2 star.  It's going to hinge on service.  And the service at Kitchen 56 was barely passable.  Our server was slow to get to us, took the order of a table that arrived later than us before she took ours.  She then ignored us once we got our food.  After it became clear we weren't going to see our check anytime soon, my husband gave the evil eye to the hostess, followed by a point to our server who was, in her defense, busy flirting with any and all male employees nearby. I hope that worked out for her.

If I ignore all that, I could really like Kitchen 56.  I like the simple menu of pizzas, pasta, and casual American food.  We started with the drunk bread (kind of like a deep dish pizza with bread soaked in white wine and butter).  It sounded better than it is.  However, my burger was great, and I could see Kitchen 56 being a great go-to spot for me.

3 stars because 2 of us thought it was really good and 2 of us thought it was just good. Went here last night with a 4-some around 9pm on a Saturday; they weren't very busy and we were seated promptly. The server was attentive and taking drink orders almost immediately. For dinner I had the Arcadia Pie cuz I love me some goat cheese and bacon. It was tasty but there wasn't a sauce on the pizza and I kinda wished it had a drizzle of an herbed olive oil or something cuz it was just a lil dry. The boyfriend loved the pork tenderloin saying it was spiced perfectly. Another at our table had the tofu dish which she described as the best tofu she's ever had (she apparently had been here earlier in the week and had the same dish then too.)  The pulled pork sandwich across the table from me looked pretty tasty too, but didn't get the raving review the others did. 
They have some really interesting sounding cocktails on their menu... Maple Manhattan anyone? Their wine list is extensive and fairly priced as well. They have a giant cinnamon roll on their wknd breakfast menu that I would love to tackle along with a latte sometime soon!
8:52 pm and the kitchen is closed!!!! Hell man this is a local Resturant that is not open for business. Crazy

Finally had the chance to stop in for lunch with a few girlfriends as I have been wanting to try Kitchen 56 for a long time now. We got there about 12:15 and it wasn't too busy at all and we were seated right away. We ordered the Pretzel Dippers to start and they were very yummy! We then ordered our lunch. I had the Vegetable Firebread, my girlfriends had the Turkey Firebread and Turkey Cranberry Firebread and they all came with fries. When they came out we were shocked at how big the servings were! You can easily share a sandwich with someone as we all took the other 1/2 with us to go. I LOVED my Firebread sandwich. The vegetables were great and the spread wasn't too overpowering. Both my girlfriends really liked their sandwiches too. The services was great and I cannot wait to bring my boyfriend back for lunch or dinner soon!

I really, really wanted to love this place. 
The live music was...fine...but SO LOUD. They took the black bean burger off the menu, which is a big bummer. The restaurant itself is really cool, and I liked the overall design layout, but service was mediocre and the salad I paid a million dollars for was small and not thrilling. 

I'd like to go back for drinks and apps and see how it goes.

Woah. Talk about small portions. $17 for the Roasted Chicken plate & it was literally the smallest dish ever. Not even a side included. Ate it in LITERALLY 3 minutes (more like swallowed). Not happy. Not coming back.

Let's start with all the positives at Kitchen 56. Extremely friendly staff at this restaurant. Love the service behind the bar very attentive towards customers. Great looking space with nice decor and atmosphere! Right off 56th St & Indian School this is a prime Arcadia location. This part I hate having to talk about. The negatives of Kitchen 56, starting with the very limited dinner menu. Not a lot of options on the menu. I decided to keep it easy and try two of the choices available. The burger and pulled pork sandwich. Picking two of the less expensive items as a way to gauge this place. See If I would trust them with one of their more advanced dishes. The trust is just not there folks. The burger which was order medium well came out over well done and dry. No flavor, just the presence of a slightly burnt bun with cheese. Would not be fair to even consider this as an entry in any best burger competition. On to the pulled pork, this came out cold to taste. Literally the meat was cold on the bun which tells me it has been refrigerated. Even though I overheard one of the servers telling another guest they are a fresh kitchen. Nothing is prepared in advance all fresh. Bottom line is you'd be better off going to In & Out Burger or Dicky's BBQ. To be fair the French fries were delicious on both orders. I do appreciate how nice everyone was here though!

Ambiance: This converted gas station to diner has a unique vibe. Perhaps a modern yet retro/relaxed character would best describe it. The large dog friendly patio opens to a super huge service window that services the bar. The place is bigger on the inside than it appears from the outside. Patrons mostly 30 something's and up. Lots white collars on weekdays and a good mix on weekends. 

Food: Great selection of salads and sandwiches, all well prepared with quality touches but wouldn't go so far as to call it a artisan sandwiches. I had the Caesar salad and Turkey cranberry sandwich both were great! Appreciated the focaccia bread and havarti cheese. Generous portions. Impressive beer/cocktail list as well.

Price: At 13 dollars a sandwich I thought it was a bit steep but perhaps it's par for course for the area, not sure as I don't frequent this part of town.

Service: I ate at the bar, was well attended to. Food served promptly.

Overall: I can see this place as a great spot for a business lunch and cocktail during the week or bring the dog and some friends for a weekend lunch and beer.

While exploring the Arcadia, I stumbled acrossed this place. The first thing you notice when you walk in is the smell from the wood fire grill.  The establishment is very clean and the staff was very prompt and friendly.  The happy hour prices are spectacular, with the portion size.  Happy hour tacos for 6 dollars, came with a surprising 4 tacos.  That's right not 2 or 3; but 4.    Definitely worth the stop and coming back for sure

I had the macaroni and cheese which was very good, but the server and hostess were so rude and slow that I'll never go back again.  We knew what we wanted right away and I asked if we could put in our meal order after he took our drink order (3 waters, please), and he straight up said, "No, I'll take your order after I bring your drinks."  SO rude.  Our server never came to check on us after we got our food.  We had been done with our meal for about five minutes and our server walked right by me, I looked at him and waved to him as he walked by to get the check and he completely ignored me.  I'll never ever go back.

Had a recent birthday party here.  They were kind enough to let me bring my own cake and take over a large portion of their restaurant on a Saturday.  (We had about 50-60 folks drop in over the course of 4:00 p.m. to about 8:00).  During HH, the drinks are $5.00 and many appetizers are very reasonably priced.  The food was devoured quickly and without complaint.  Brittni the manager was very gracious about letting us have so many people there.
One thing I will say is that parking is tricky.  Their lot is not big and they have another gated area across the street that filled up rather quickly.  I should have told people to car pool!  They opened up the patio area which made the restaurant quite warm.  Other than that, the guests really enjoyed themselves.  It is family friendly, (they have high chairs and whatnot), with a good menu that has enough variety to keep lots of people happy.  Great sangria and they even have a "Pickle Back".  Check it out on the menu :)

Visited kitchen 56 yesterday for an early dinner, food was Wonderful. I ate with friends that are Vegan and they were able to eat plenty from the menu. The edamame appetizer was so flavorful, will get that again! Our waiter was great, helpful with getting vegan items correct. Will be back for brunch next time!

(Lyrics - Elvis Presley - Heartbreak Hotel)

Well since I got really hungry
I found a new place to dwell.
Its off Indian School and 56th Street
At Kitchen 56

You make me so hungry baby
I get so hungry
I get so hungry I could die

And although it's always crowded,
You still can find some room.
Where very hungry foodies
Do write away their review

You make me so hungry baby
I get so hungry
I get so hungry I could die

Kitchen 56 is located at the border of Arcadia and S. Scottsdale.  It has a vintage full service gas station ambient with a modern twist.  Who knew this would work so well!  I attended on a Sunday evening for the all day HH on drinks and live music was a rocking!

It was a lazy Sunday so I ordered me a PBR, yep....yep....yep.  For only $2 a can man that's some cheap fass beer!  Though not much taste I can still appreciate me some PBR and how long it has survived the test of time.  For my entree I ordered their Black Angus burger with fries.  Needless to say, and to my surprise.  It was one damn good fass burger!  Cooked medium and oozing American cheese all over with the fresh crunch of the onions and pickles gave this delectable burger between some butter bread and awesome POW to my palates!  Yummy!  I don't recall talking much that night.  

Service was awesome our waiter was quite knowledgeable about the menu plus his recommendations were definitely appreciated.  Can't wait to go back and another round and neither should you! - Enjoy!

This is a local/neighborhood restaurant that has struggled since it opened.  The food is so-so; the hours somewhat sporadic, in that the restaurant and bar closes whenever business seems slow later in the evening; but service is by far its main downfall.  The last time I took my family there, it was over10 minutes after being seated before anyone made contact with us; it took us nearly 45 minutes after placing a food order to get the food (the place was not really busy); and no one bothered to check to see if things were alright at any point.

Tonight, I thought I'd give it another shot.  Again, I took the family, hoping to support a neighborhood business.  There were 3 servers working, and only 4 tables taken by customers.  Remarkably, it again took nearly 10 minutes for a server to make contact or ask for drink orders, then a long time to get the drinks.  Again, no one bothered to check on us after the food was served, even for new drink orders, which we would have made.  Instead of enjoying a meal out, we wound up aggravated, with over-tired and hungry kids.

One might think this is just bad luck, but on both occasions, the owner/manager was in the immediate vicinity, seemingly oblivious to what was going on around her.

Also, beware, although the childrens' menu says "drinks included" in the entree price of $6.00, this place charged us for the kids' milk.

Save your money and go down Indian School in either direction  There are several places that know what they are doing (not meaning OHSO).

Kitchen 56 is a great place to stop in during lunch or happy hour. We've had virtually every thing on the menu and the food is always great. They have a fantastic outdoor seating area and will periodically host live music. The restaurant also has a wonderful history. Their downsides are that they redid the menu last year and a lot of our favorites are no longer there, service has been lacking a little lately and they raised their prices (they would've had more stars if it weren't for these things). I guess restaurants think this is something they should automatically do when they are in the Arcadia area.

I wish I lived closer and had a bike because a lot of their customers who were there on a Sunday afternoon came on their bikes and if I had a bike I would ride mine here.
The open, airy layout and the windows create a very cheerful atmosphere. Inside is FRC concept decor:modern and casual.
I started with a petite salad which I am mixed on. The dressing was a brandy vinaigrette which I was not crazy about. I don't like sweet dressings so that's what killed it. However the greens themselves were SO fresh I would have sworn they were picked from a garden, washed and served to me. It's greens like that that make me want to be an active salad eater instead of having one because my Mom always made me have one.
My salad was followed by an Angus Burger which, good God, was AMAZING! The TWO patties prepared a perfect medium rare with, again, a red onion and lettuce that I swear were picked from a garden and put on my burger. The menu said that it was served with American cheese, which I HATE but this had to be the best damned American cheese I've ever had.
It was a struggle to finish but I stayed the course.......and I succeeded. This was a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon. They have a bar that opens to a patio with some seating, and get this, a ping pong table. They'd better keep me the hell away from that after I've had a few otherwise guests are going to get hit.
Definitely going on my faves list for Phoenix. Can't wait to come back for dinner.

I've been wondering about this place for a while and always heard it's just OK but decided to give it a try. Well- it's just OK. Nothing particularly bad, but not that great either.  It seems like a great place for appetizers and drinks on a nice day, but my salad was average and pricey.

Today I wanted to go back to Kitchen 56 for dinner with my best friend Katy Andrew. We were hoping that the young lady who waited on us the last time would be there. And there she was Sara who by the way had a Large White watch (inside joke). She was as business and friendly as the first time. 
 
The hostess sat us at a table for 4 people and this family came in and they looked like they really wanted to have dinner at the Kitchen 56 and I felt they Katy and I did not need a table for 4 so as they were leaving I stood up and flagged them to stay and gave up our table and we moved to a table for 2. This family was much appreciated, I said to them if I do something nice for someone else someone will do something nice for someone else. I felt I did what was right. The hostess was so happy that she gave Katy and I 2 free desserts.

Now for what we had for dinner I had the pork ribs with fries, corn cake and house slaw it was off the charts. Katy had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy and she said it was awesome.

The desserts we had were a brownie with berry sauce and vanilla ice cream and the second one was a baked chocolate chip cookie with vanilla ice cream. The whole meal was awesome.

We wanted to make the family feel special so we had Sara give them the Fudge Brownie dessert after we left. I would have loved to see their faces when it arrived.

Keep up the good work Kitchen 56 your the best.
Awesome food, drinks and service! Came here after a great time at comedy store! Will be back again!

A couple of things stuck out to me for this place. One was the really clean and refreshing ambience they've got going on. The other thing that stuck out was the lightness, yet tastyness of the food. I had a turkey and egg sandwich, which was pretty darn good.

The staff seemed nice, too and the prices really weren't bad. I met somebody here on my lunch break and surprisingly made it back to the office in time. Sometimes it's hard to get in and out at a sit down place in an hour, but they pulled it off. However, I feel like there would be no pressure if you wanted to stay and chat for a bit.

*sigh* I really wanted to like this place. It's adorable (although a smidge overpriced).

But my (what was supposed to be fried) egg in my chilaquile was runny and gross, the carnitas had a funky flavor to them and no one bothered to ask me if that was ok or how I like my eggs. 

Since my hubby LOVES slimy eggs (*hork*), I gave the whole thing to him and just ate some bacon and potatoes, although even he thought the egg was a bit underdone. 

The saving grace for me was the black cherry lemonade (made with alcohol and muddled black cherries).

One of my favorite places to meet friends! They have a great Happy Hour menu and the service is always great.

My personal faves are the homemade potato chips with dip (always a hit!) and the Calamari Salad. The Calamari was always my "go-to" dish, but the last 2 times I've ordered it I've been disappointed.  I've been told about kitchen staff changes and recipe changes, but I feel like they took a great recipe and ruined it.

I still love the location, staff and ambiance, so I'll just find new dishes to order. I've had their mushroom pizza and a few of their other dishes. All good. Hopefully no more recipe changes in the future.

It has been a while since I've been this excited about a new place.  I have passed by countless times, but finally decided to check this place out and I took my mom for brunch for Mother's Day.  I went back for dinner this past weekend I liked it so much.  Both times the service was great and the food was delicious!

When I went for brunch I ordered the chilaquiles and Kitchen 56 is easily at the top of the list for great chilaquiles.  The perfect amount of spice (enough to taste it and give a good kick  without being over the top) in the sauce and the flour tortillas weren't greasy at all.  So often when the tortillas are fried in-house they come out greasy and more stale than crisp, but they were crunchy.  I tried the backporch 'adult' lemonade.  It was very refreshing and not overly sweet which I loved.

For my second visit I ordered the Short Ribs from the dinner menu and they were amazing! The meat was fork tender and tasty!  The mashed potatoes were seasoned well and had a great black pepper kick to them.  They were are little thicker and starchier than I would usually prefer (but that just proved that they were fresh made in house and not rehydrated out of a box which is the way I like it!!).  I also split the beet salad and it was amazing!  The balsamic dressing has a great bite to it without being too acidic from the vinegar and it goes so well with the crispy pancetta and goat cheese.  With the right protein the salad could easily be an entree meal!  I may have overindulged a bit when it comes to cocktails, but I tried the Moscow Mule and the '56' Cooler.  The Mule was spot on for what you'd expect.  I was intrigued by the '56' Cooler because it was basically a margarita with St Germain.....something about St Germain just draws me in.  Great balance of flavors between the grapefruit juice and the St Germain!

I can't wait to go again and try something else new on the menu.  I can't imagine that I'd be disappointed with anything on the menu!

After months of being shut down for remodeling this neighborhood gem reopened.  The staff is very friendly and excellent service.  We love hitting up happy hours spots let me say the chicken tacos and the short rib tacos are super tasty and quite filling. We also ordered the cauliflower risotto that was the bomb!  They have nice patio love the new redesign on the inside. The only downside is the parking lot is a little small. Great neighborhood hangout with nice ambiance and excellent food!

While I was here.. there were sanitation issues with the cooks in the kitchen. One we saw touching his hair with gloves on then continued to work with food. Waiter got the order wrong, Dropped a towel used for cleaning tables on the floor then continues to use it. The Food was nothing special. I would have tried this place again for a second chance but for the sanitation practices of the staff. They need a stronger kitchen manager and a FOH manager! Very Disappointing!

Quick trip to Phoenix and came here on our daughter's recommendation, loved the place!  Very nice atmosphere, not too upscale and not too casual.  Seemed to be a lot of business-types in there coming to grab a bite or drink after work.  The food was delicious and the portions were huge.  Definitely grab the green chili mac-n-cheese if you come!
Just had an amazing lunch! Added chicken to the Arcadia Salad. Highly recommend!!

I can't say I've had a bad experience here yet. Green chile Mac= delish. Pizza= stellar (no, not a quote on quote pizza place but still serves up a really good pie). The burgers have always been very tasty as well. The one thing I would criticize is the portions on some of the food. The mac n cheese is not exactly a hefty portion, and the salads are a bit on the small side. Other than that, A+. 
It's a mostly quiet restaurant with a nice, dog friendly patio and an enjoyable bar to sit at. We probably go here once a month and will continue to do so.

Stopped in for a business lunch. Nice enough place inside. About 20-25% full. Uh-oh. Good looking craft brews on tap. Menu looked solid. Interesting sandwiches and salads. I ordered the barbecued pulled pork sandwich with onion strings. Onion strings on the sandwich were cold-ish, weird. The pork itself was very bland, and the barbecue sauce was nothing to write home about (I can't explain the reviewer love I see on the postings next to mine). My colleagues seemed to like their meals o.k., but no one was talking about their meals or sharing what they got, so that speaks volumes.

This place might be worth a shot with a better chef/cook or better recipes. Looks good on paper, but I can't recommend it. Too many good options nearby to make this a go-to place.

Today was a beautiful day to have brunch with a girlfriend in this airy place.  I loved seeing people with their dogs.  The 56 scramble was good for me and the French toast my friend had looked amazing. I also enjoyed my green tea lemonade cocktail.  I will be back!

Go for Stephen. At the bar. You want to talk? He's interesting. Want to stay buried in your phone? Cool. Want food recommendations and the plate delivered fast? Stephen. 

Yes. The kitchen is solid. They know what they are doing back there. But Stephen at the bar. He gets the five star. 

Note it.

We stumbled across this place while looking for a friend's house in the area, so we dropped in for a drink.  From the outside it doesn't look like much and generally once inside it also is less than impressive.  As we only had time for a drink we asked for a menu to check out what they had to offer.  The menu was a very pleasant surprise with dishes one would never expect to find based on the area, outside look of the place and the inside atmosphere.  We decided to come back later, that was a couple of months ago and we've been back many times since and have introduced our friends to the excellent food at this establishment.  The staff is well versed on the menu, is helpful but not pushy.  The wine list is very good and the food is outstanding.  Don't judge this book by the cover.  We go back often, finding that each new dish is a good at the last if not better!

Great spot near old town! We started off with the adult lemonades, really delicious, I had the blueberry one and my friend got the strawberry one. Themn we got the drunk bread and edamame apps, omg both so good but the drunk bread was delicious!!! 

I got the ahi sandwich and it was delicious. My friend got the burger, she enjoyed it, my family got the trout special, ribs, and a pasta dish. All were well enjoyed.

We were too full for dessert, but another time for sure!

I hate to write such a blah review, but I was really disappointed with the drunk bread. It really was nothing special and without being drunk, totally avoidable. While the Patio is really quite nice, I don't see any other reason to go.
AWESOME dose not even come close.  I have enjoyed my dining experience there.  I love the atmosphere and the wait staff.  GREAT FOOD and the best Arnold Palmer I have ever had!

A friend and I had lunch at Kitchen 56 a couple weeks ago, well I'm a BIG FAN!  I ordered the BurgerDeluxe , yes I'm a huge burger snob, at any rate, I always judge a place by how they make or will make their burgers.  I ordered it Very Extra Rare...and Yes that IS exactly how it was served.  Our server said, and I quote, "I told the chef that you indeed wanted it to only be introduced to the grill, not actually to date the grill".  How Perfect Was That???  It was just perfect and I was giddy the entire meal.  The service was not over agressive, just attentive. The balance of the meal consisted of my dining partner had the pulled pork.  She liked it a lot and would go back!  The onion marmalade on my burger was extremely note worthy.  Just the right balance of sweet without losing the onion flavor!  

So I say, Go Forth and Enjoy Kitchen 56.!.!.!...
Love their green chilli mac. I have been here twice now and have not been disappointed. The first I had a sandwich and it was delicious as well.
This place is great!! A must try! give this place a shot its totally worth it. we all love Indy places!
Excellent service. Fantastic food. Great combination.

WAS really good, but I guess they changed their menu and chef. We talked about the wings here for a very long time but we're completely disappointed with the resent change. Wings were burnt and tasted different. No more amazing kale wraps. Ordered a beet salad that had no pecans like it said on the menu. Will not be returning. There goes another good spot.
A people-friendly, dog-friendly, local joint that is truly a neighborhood gem. Steve and the other bartenders will treat you and your furry friend(s) like family.

Good drinks, good food.

Whether its the pulled pork sandwich (for which they have no problem giving extra sides of bbq sauce), the steak salad or tender short ribs, I have a seriously hard time not reordering the same things over and over.  Every visit here I've tried something different and have yet to be disappointed.  

BTW, the housemade chips are light and crispy and go great with a dark and stormy or moscow mule.  

Aside from the food, the service has always been accommodating.  On one visit, we had barely 30 minutes to eat and drink in order to make a flight.  Everything was rushed to our table asap (despite the restaurant being full) and as they were ready.  We were in and out with time to spare.  

I can't wait for my next visit and to try something new.

Love this place!!! The food and the drinks are amazing. Stacey did a great job making our bloody Mary's. She deserves a promotion from serving. Great personality and outstanding service. Thanks again Stacey, see you next time!!!
Kitchen 56 has great food, and clean atmosphere, great patio, and friendly staff.

1st timers and we hope to come back soon!  Nice ambiance inside or out, nice selection of Happy Hour appetizers (meals).  The calamari salad & wood fired pizza were very good.  My wife loved the Green Tea Lemonade, and our server was very knowledgeable & attentive.

stopped by for a Happy Hour beer and to watch some basketball, and the people at the bar and behind the bar were so much fun that I stayed for dinner - had baby back ribs and WOW - excellent flavor and fall off the bone tender; great quality ribs.
great neighborhood hangout.

Lovely find, I had to use bathroom so pulled in here. Order food and it was delicious!!  Goat cheese on my burger. And the drink was wonderful.   We will be stopping by here again. Plus the bartender looked like a young Blondie (The singer). I just liked this place. Quiet and great service!!

Maybe lunch isn't the best time to try Kitchen 56. I thought it was just okay.

The boyfriend and I stopped in for lunch on a Saturday and we were literally the only customers there. But everyone was very friendly and we got our food very fast since it's not like the kitchen was busy!

I ordered a salad and boyfriend ordered the mac and cheese. First thing we noticed was that all the dishes were chipped. Each bowl had at least 3 chips on it. Do they have a clumsy dishwasher? Is that the look they are going for? Not sure but it was a little off-putting to eat off of broken dishes.

The salad was pretty good. Not great. Decent enough size but the dressing was kinda blah. Boyfriend felt the same way about his mac and cheese. It was good but not great.

I wish the food had been better because I liked the atmosphere and like I said the staff was very nice. I just don't feel compelled to go back again. Sorry!

Live around corner... Decided to try... Loved the ambiance. Sat outside on patio. Super cute. Food was so so. The flatbread with Rosemary is w rip off. 8 dollars for pita and oil and balsamic. Pizza was just ok. La grande is a lotttttt better. The worst part: the service. We came on a Wednesday night after happy hour. Our waitress we just horrendous. Forgot about our table every time we asked for something. I finally got up to ask her for something and she was eating something in the back. Awful awul. Won't be returning.

My 87 year old grandmother took me here for lunch at noon on Friday. The restaurant was initially quite busy. We ordered the edamame starter. It was a large portion, heavily seasoned. My entree was the stir fry, while my grandmother ordered a large salad. The food came out quickly. My stir fry was alright but nothing I couldn't have had both better and cheaper at decent Chinese take out. My grandmother's salad was large but perhaps overpriced for a salad with no protein in it. 

The reason for two stars is because my grandmother asked our server for help deciding a dessert that had been recently recommended in a newspaper review. The server was not helpful in recalling the item referenced in the prior-day's review. Giving up, we ordered two Creme brûlées.  At this point, the restaurant  was very quiet. It was about ten minutes after ordering that I glanced over to the kitchen pass-through and saw a single Creme brûlée sitting there on the counter. Another ten minutes passed before a different server noticed it and brought it to our table. I do not know if the bill had one or two desserts charged, but two were ordered and we only got one. It took so long for one to arrive that we didn't have time to wait for a second. 

This incident, coupled with inattentive drink refills, makes me wonder if the young professionals in the restaurant getting their wine on during lunch break received  the same treatment as did my senior grandmother and my young female self.

Poor service & mediocre service.
We went because they had Ahi on the menu (trying to keep on WW plan). We ordered our entrees, and the black bean dip (yes, ignoring the fact there is probably gobs of cheese in it).  We asked if we can have some cut up veggies with it aside .. The waiter had to go ask, then telling us it would be additional $3 (seriously??).  After we receive the dip and gold plated zucinni slices, the waiter came back to tell us they are out of Ahi.  So is asked if I can replace the fries with the brussel sprout side on the steak frites dinner ... "No, but you can sub the fries with more salad".  So we had to order the sprouts on the side.  The Steak came out cooked nicely, but it would had been nice if they'd seasoned the steak ... even the chimichuri was bland.  Very very disappointed!!

Great open atmosphere! Somewhat of a hipster vibe. My husband said the pulled pork sandwich was the best he ever had. I had the 56 Loco. Short ribs with egg and risotto, which was a little salty, but good. The dog friendly patio is also cute with a water feature. Love the smoky smell of the wood burning.
Worth trying once. The service was good. The food is good, but nothing over the top. My pork chop was a little dry but the calamari and mashed potatoes were tasty. Loved the brownie for dessert.

I think 3.5 stars had green chili burger no bun, salad instead of fries - great taste! Pablano peppers had touch oh cold probably cooked in advance than added to burger. Manager spent time everywhere but visiting with the guest.

Stopped in for lunch this weekend.  Our server was very nice (can't remember his name) and food was fresh and fast.  Salad and turkey sandwich were both pretty big, more than enough to share.  Very nice place.  Will go back soon

I was so excited to try this place out! I drive by all the time and thought it looked like a fun little place. The ambience is great and the food choices looked delicious. We had the corn cakes for an appetizer which is basically corn pancakes with pulled pork. Ok, but not great. I ordered the black bean burger for dinner and it was so bad I had to send it back. It looked like something pulled from the freezer and heated up, then topped with a refrigerator cold onion marmalade. Terrible. They happy replaced my meal with a margarita pizza which was ok at best. Overall the 2 stars are for the ambience. The service was fine, but the food was bad. Very disappointing.

You Arcadia folks are going to love Kitchen 56. Remodeled inside an old Car / Mechanical repair shop this place has tons of character. They kept pictures of the old mechanic shop up around for nostalgia and makes a good conversation starter if you bring a friend who has never been before. 

Their cocktails and bartenders have their stuff together for sure. Let them recommend one of the summa cocktails to refresh with natural fresh ingredients. Delish ISH!

The negative: Its a bit pricey, you won't be frequenting this place, even if you live in Arcadia due to the price.
Didn't hate it, didn't love it.  And they served me a desert they knew was bad.  If you know its bad don't serve it, very simple.  Upside is they have cucumber vodka.

We love us some K56, so many great things to try on the menu! Every trip is an adventure! Kitchen 56 takes pride in it's food and it shows, not to mention the varied menu, there truly is something for everyone here (even our pickiest friends can find something they like).

We tried the Wood-Fired Pizza - they have six different wood fired pizzas to choose from so it was a very difficult choice. I had tried the Spicy Salami & Sausage with San Marzano Sauce, fresh Mozzarella, herbs and spiced oil previously which was great, amazing crust, super delish toppings but we decided to try a different pizza this time. The Arcadia Pie features goat cheese instead of a more traditional mozzarella, leeks (for you foodie types), scallions, garlic and bacon. Winner. Winner... yep, very tasty. Of course bacon on anything is a sure hit but it was a nice compliment to the goat cheese and leeks, I would definitely recommend trying this for a nice change from your traditional pizza.

Who can resist Onion Strings... not us! They call them Onion Straws here but by either name they are a treat! The batter was not to thick, nice and light and the dipping sauce is was a spicy remoulade, which was a perfect compliment and a big hit at the table. Food you can eat with your fingers is always welcome at our table, call us low maintenance!

Read complete review here... http://schmoozeaz.com/blog/?p=940

We have eaten at Kitchen 56 twice, yesterday being the most recent. The restaurant was busy and the live music was playing on the outside seating area. We sat in the bar at a high top table and took in the music and enjoyed the lively bar scene. As usual the food was super. We shared an artisan cheese plate with a bottle of Chardonnay. Both we very good. Then we shared a calzone and steak salad. The portions and prices are reasonable and the food was tasty. Our server was also the bartender and although he was super busy at the bar he was also very attentive to our needs. Extra parking is available across the street and we used it on this busy night. We will certainly be back.
Since reopen the service and menu are awful! It is no longer a cute neighborhood restaurant! Miss  he old kitchen 56!

We ate here with my cousin and his family, he lives close so he suggested this place. I looked at the menu and saw green chili burger so it was a yes. 
We showed up just before 6 so we ordered a few things on the happy hour menu and my cousin and I got the green chili burger. It was very unimpressive and very plain, first I think it needed more green chili peppers, that might have helped. 
we ordered pretzel dippers, wings and edemame..  The pretzel dippers are very good and would order again, the wings are just ok and the edemame was my least favorite of all time. sitting in some crazy salty teriyaki or soy sauce.

Went there for lunch and it took them forever to split our checks! As for the food, it was OK. I would recommend starting with the Chip & Dip....be careful it is addictive! Some of my co-workers tried the Firebread and none of them could finish their meal because their house made Ciabatta bread was so dense & heavy, not the typical texture for Ciabatta. Their side slaw was good. I also tasted their mac & cheese which was decent but rather heavy too. Menu was rather limited in my opinion.

I ordered the green chili angus beef burger here. It was okay. There's not much in the burger that costs $10. It was only the green chili, patty, and cheese. I did not like the buns. It was dry. The rest of the items on the menu seemed too pricey for me, which is why I ended up ordering a burger.
This place is good , for sit down and drink.  Now I wouldn't come here during the summer, the

Truly deserves 5 stars, and here is why!  Drove from Tucson to Phoenix on a Friday night to pick up someone from the airport.  Had our dog with us!  Called ahead to O.H.S.O.  Was told they had a 20 minute wait for the patio.  Arrived, no parking, you MUST valet.  So we did.  Went inside, and it was nuts!  Very popular place!  Was then told an hour and half wait.  "what happened to a 20 minute wait?"  The hostess laughed and said, "who told you that?"  I told her the guy's name who answered the phone.  She apologized.  So we picked up our valeted car.  Went on Yelp, saw Kitchen 56 just down the road, also dog friendly.  Called ahead, said they would hold a table for us.  Arrived, plenty of parking, and a much nicer place from the outside!  Went inside, we were greeted and sat quickly on a beautiful, and clean patio.  The server could not have been nicer, and was eager to help us out with our time constraint to get to the airport.  She immediately brought out a cold water bowl for our pooch!  We hadn't even asked!  Our food was delicious and arrived quickly! And she was very prompt with our check as well, knowing we had to eat and run!  We will be back on our next trip up!  It's a lovely place, clean, and very nice atmosphere!

Did I  mention "Dog Friendly!"

I drive past this place all the time en route to go elsewhere.  One afternoon a friend and I decided to try a new place for a Sunday Funday.

Hey there all day happy hour!!! One of the few places that have an all day HH on Sundays!  Fantastic.

The staff was outgoing and friendly and with great specials on food and drink you can't beat it.  I am dinging a star because while the bartender did point out the happy hour drink specials, we had no idea that there were FOOD specials.  This was never mentioned nor was the HH food menu given to us. We found this out AFTER we ordered and ate.  Annoying.

The food was delicious as were the drinks. 

The live music is a nice relaxing touch and the patio is spacious with a small fountain, although misters would be nice outside.

We try to come here at least once a week for their happy hour specials, we can't get enough of the fish tacos and spicy cilantro wings! The service has always been excellent, our servers have been attentive and knowledgeable each time. The restaurant is beautiful, last week we were lucky enough to sit on the patio, it was a perfectly lovely evening!

This place is just awesome. Love the simplistic menu that offers great choices.
Great craft beers - the Modus Hoperandi is a lovely IPA and Osborn Hefe are just full of flavour.
Always love coming back here - the wine bar is lovely and offers a nice selection and the bar is low key, fully stocked and is a great place to meet for a casual drink..

A cool place to eat and drink located in a "historic" spot.  Kitchen 56 was converted from an abandoned classic gas station into a modern little restaurant.  If you take the time to notice your surroundings, you can kind of tell the location's history by the convenient store layout of the restaurant and the parking lot.  Or just take a hint from giant picture of the old gas station on the wall.

The menu is interesting but very hit and miss.  We tried the drunk bread because it just sounded like something that we had to try.  Bread soaked in wine and baked with a gooey cheese.  It looked great when it arrived at the table, but when we had a bite, it tasted like you're the one getting drunk.  I didn't taste the wine flavor, I felt it.  A unique idea, but unfortunate fail.

I had the smoked salmon pizza.  It's like a bagel and cream cheese with arugula spread across the top.  It was pretty good, nothing I'd go out of my way to have again.  The arugula was just kind of toss on the top, so it fell all over the place.  My girlfriend had the short ribs, which were awesome.  The celery root puree it was place over was incredible.  The other couple we dined with had the pork tenderloin and the filet.  The filet came with sautéed onions (an oddly big portion placed off to the side) and green chile macaroni.

The macaroni is were we noticed some trouble with the service.  It the side dish was cool when the plate arrived.  No big deal, my friend who ordered it simply told the server.  He took the whole plate to have it fixed.  That's pretty lame for just a side dish.  She had to sit and wait while they heated everything back up.  It only took a few minutes, but felt a little unnecessary.  A manager did come out to apologize and check if everything was okay.  We also didn't come close to finishing the drunk bread, but no one ever said anything or asked us how it was.  The runner that brought us our food simply asked if we were done and cleared it.  Usually, if an appetizer for the table is not finished, that should be a sign that it was not enjoyed.  Perhaps a good time to ask the customers if there's something they can do to make it better the next time.

None of it was a terrible experience.  This is one of those unfortunate times when I wish Yelp gave half stars.  While I feel Kitchen 56 is better than A-Ok, it certainly is not at a point were I'd say I am definitely a fan.  If I lived closer to the arcadia area, I'd probably be more open to going back to give it another try.  There's plenty on the menu that I would like to try.  But there's too many places closer to me in north Scottsdale that I would prefer to try first.

One other random note.  When we first arrived, there was a young girl playing some acoustic guitar.  It was a little awkward that she was just sitting at table near the entrance (there's no stage or anything like that), but she was pretty good and it was quite enjoyable.  There's always something nice about subtle light live music.  She was only there until about 7:00.  I highly recommend they find a way to feature someone like her, and have that musician stay later.

The staff has become family to us since we've started coming here over a year ago. It seems that everyone who is a regular here becomes great friends with the staff and the other regulars.

 A fancy ambience, but somewhere you can come in casual attire and not feel uncomfortable. 

 and they have the best menu options ever! 

Great selection of burgers, pizza, pasta and various appetizers. 

And get the cinnamon doughnuts with chocolate dip for dessert!

We were so excited when this restaurant was re-opening - but unfortunately last Monday night we made the mistake of having happy hour there and getting takeout food. It was unbelievably understaffed -the positivesthat the wine is cold and their wings are good. The food that we got to go was an "Arcadia salad" that was drenched in vinaigrette to the point where it was inedible and a cauliflower soup that was so salty that it couldn't be consumed. The loaded baked potato entrée with pork was edible but also tepid. If you're looking for hot food or enough staff to actually serve you - probably need to head down Indian school to another restaurant. Are the owners actually reading any of these reviews? It seems like the bartenders are doing a great job of mixing the 25 specialty drinks they have on the menu and the wings are great but all of the food is either coming out slow, cold, and/or poorly made... Hopefully the owners can respond to us in the community and let us know what they are doing to change their poorly staffed restaurant and their serious kitchen issues?
Love the simple menu. Why have choices if what you have is your BEST to offer?! Great lunch/dinner & bar experience.
New kitchen staff ... Food is fantastic.  Kobe burgers are hot and juicy. Drinks are the best.  Visit when Leah is behind the bar ... She is the "worst" of the best --/just kidding she's the best!!!!

We had a party of 8 and all of us had never been here. The service was great, the appetizers delicious and drinks were superb. We all ordered different entrees and not one complaint from anyone! Everyone in my party thought the food was scrumptious!  Great job K56! We will return!!

Yummy...yummy...yummy... was with work buddies we all enjoyed the food, drinks and service.
Our waitress was awsome considering 8 of us needed separate checks...
Drinks--- mnmm Great, especially the 56 signature drinks,
Appetizers-- pretzel dippers - perfectly soft with ok cheese dip
 --- Chips and dip -- AWSOME,   fresh made, seasoned  potato chips and dip ...sssoooo gooood.
--green chile mac n cheese -   meh ok
DINNER- Flat Iorn Steak  - 5 stars
- Short Ribs- 5 stars 
- Ahi Tereyaki- 5 stars
-Summer Salad with steak - 5 stars
-Bacon Mac n Cheese -4 stars 
- green chile mac n cheese needs a not more of a green chile kick!!!
We have you book marked and will be back.

We were headed to another spot and decided on a whim to give Kitchen 56 a try. The outside patio was fun and happy-looking and it, the homey woodsmoke smell, and the 'local' neon sign, drew us in. 
The menu is full of delectable taste combos and we quickly decided in the prosciutto and fig pizza and brussel sprout hash. The server, Che, was very friendly and attentive and the food came quickly.  
The pizza was very tasty,  although was more in a dessert line to my taste since its sauce is honey-based, which the menu does clearly state. Thr crust was light and airy with just the right crispness. The sprouts were also done nicely, with just a touch of crunch.  The two of us split the pizza and hash and we still had leftovers.  
The other diners were a mix of young families and couples in their 40s. The price point was very reasonable, especially by Scottsdale standards. I would definitely come again if I was in the area and might even make a special trip.

Our friend goes here nearly every Friday so we decided to bike down and try it. The drinks and wings are where its at! Tender, juicy and great flavor - just spicy enough. We had burgers and they were pretty good too. The drinks however are simple yet creative and the happy hour is decently priced. I would definitely make this one of the regulars of the stomping ground for the wings and drinks alone.

This is a great place if you like good beer and good wine. The staff is always friendly, especially at the bar. You can't go wrong on the menu. Personal favorites are the drunk bread, Arcadia pie, and the Arcadia salad. Enjoy!

Since being redone, Kitchen 56 has got it perfect.  It's a great casual dining experience, not uptight at all.  The indoor,outdoor bar is great for nighttime summer dining.  I love wall mural of the old gas station that used to occupy the space.  

When I think of service at a casual place, I really focus on speed.  As I sat down at the bar, my drink was on the way and the menu was there.  After ordering, my food was out in less than 10 minutes.  That's about as good as you can get for casual dining.  Especially with the quality of food.
